name: Riverfront City Park
address: 200 Water St NE, Salem, OR 97301, USA
reviews: Love it. While I need some repairs it really is a cross-section of Salem. Dog walkers and hikers, picnics and kids playing.  You can even walk across the railroad trestle to Wallace Marine Park and visit the homeless camps the City of Salem just put up. That was said tongue in cheek.  If you live inside the Salem City limits, please remember to fire the mayor and city council when you vote.

I've always loved this park! It has grown and have been molded into something that other towns are envious of. With the newly built walking bridge across the river, it allows people to be much more active. I can't wait to see more to be added to the park.

This iconic park has always been a staple for Willamette Valley residents. When they installed the carousel two decades ago it was a very appropriate monument to a time with less technology. For the longest time this park had one of the last phone booths in Salem. This park has just about everything. The carousel, it shares property with the children's science museum, copious walking trails and direct access to the Minto Brown Park trail system.

Really nice park space for all ages. Splash pad in the summer, regular park activities and movie nights in the summer. Being connected to Minto-Brown island opens up tons of new day adventures and bike riding opportunities.
So great to see the connectivity of the park system with a waterfront appeal! Nice amenities and large grassy areas. One of the better downtown parks in the NW

name: Minto-Brown Island Park
address: 2200 Minto Island Rd SW SE, Salem, OR 97302, USA
reviews: I have been coming here since I was a little kid, i grew up walking all the trails in this park and even as an adult today I continue to do so. This is one of my favorite parks to roam endlessly through and you can definitely do that here. There are hours worth of trails you can walk around whether you want to walk through some wooded areas or fields or walk alongside the river, this place has it all. Its peaceful, its serene, its clean, and it's safe.

👍👍HUGE, beautiful park. Floating dock to fish from or swim in river from. Off leash pets welcome. Salem Park Operations does an AMAZING job taking care of our parks, which there are approximately 70 or so. Check them out and bring your appitite... there are barbecues!👩‍🌾

Incredible dog park we're talking football field maybe longer and significantly wider, walking paths and trails for miles, kids play set doesn't compare to keizer rapids but they have a nice gazebo area and lots of room for a grassy picnic.  Water access pretty close to parking areas but if your fishing you might have to walk a distance to get to that honey hole.

I have grown up in this park. There are enough paths to explore almost perpetually. The dog park is one of the largest I have ever found and the Pokemon hunting is prime. The playground could really use an update, I played on the same structures as a child.

This park is awesome!  It is beautiful with tons of trails, both paved and natural paths, and it felt safe.  The dog park is huge and so nice!  I really appreciated how dog owners were responsible and attentive to their dogs off leash, and every single time a dog went #2, the owner picked up after their dog! (This is important to us dog people who like a clean environment.) Love this park!

name: Bush's Pasture Park
address: 890 Mission St SE, Salem, OR 97302, USA
reviews: This park is nuts. When I say nuts I mean the squirrel population is booming. They are everywhere. My dog is super crazy here because there's so many squirrels to see. They take very good care of this park (yes the squirrels). I love running here as there is so much to see. My favorite part though has got to be the squirrels.

Bushes park is a wonderful place to go when you want to relax, read a good book, run or play on the playground with your kids. Very clean and the landscaping is GEORGIOS.  A GREAT PLACE TO BE WHEN YOU WANT THE COUNTRY IN THE CITY.

This is an awesome  Place so much things  To do their great for families but they do not have a disk golf course I walked the whole park and did not find one basket all in all though they have playgrounds hiking trails creeks it's very beautiful for being in the middle of a city you really forget that you're in a actually city. Great place to go spend time with family go walk around exercise or just think

Absolutely love this place. The oak trees are just amazing and the grounds are kept so clean! This is a great place to visit on a day off and I'd love to see if Salem still makes use of the soapbox derby track.
This is the biggest park in Salem. Great place for Bar B Ques or family reunions. The grass is always so green and freshly mowed. A very Beautiful Park.

name: Gilbert House Children's Museum
address: 116 Marion St NE, Salem, OR 97301, USA
reviews:
Pleasant children's museum located in the beautiful old homes. The indoor displays are simpler than the ones in other newer children's museums, making them interesting for about second grade and younger (my preschool niece lived there whole thing!). My middle school aged daughters really enjoyed the motion sensing dance room (see pic).

We were there on a rainy day, so we couldn't enjoy the outside playground. All the of our kids would have enjoyed this! There are also nice picnic areas outside. You can bring your own picnic food with you (no restaurant or snack bar on site).

Our girls ages 12, 9, and 6, love the outdoor climbing maze with it's slides.  Indoors we love the silhouette room and doctor and vet rooms where we can view x-ray pictures.  Our three year old loves the farm room milking the cow and guiding the submarine.  We took our friends there and had an outdoor lunch under the covered area.  All their boys and all our girls had a blast!

We have been coming here for 7 years and they constantly keep on working on things getting them cleaned up, coming up with new displays. Our kids really enjoy this place and it is wheelchair accessible in case you have a grandparent that wants to come watch your child play outside. We highly recommend the family membership it also works for other places around oregon as well

This is a great children's museum! The rooms don't change a lot, but they're a lot of fun! The playground outside is fantastic and big enough for adults to play too! The bummer with a museum on an old estate is that you really feel it if it's busy since there's only one way in and out of rooms into narrow hallways. Still, a great children's museum for exploring little minds!

Great place to take your little kids to play. Lots of rooms to explore and plenty to do to keep your kiddos busy! Fun to meet a friend for a play date here. My daughter loves the kitchen, atm/money, and tools area the best! Using your library pass for a visit is an added bonus!

name: Deepwood Museum & Gardens
address: 1116 Mission St SE, Salem, OR 97302, USA
reviews: The museum was open today for free tours provided by ladies wearing correct time period apparel. Nice to learn some history.

Even if you aren't a history buff, the house and the grounds are beautiful. It is worth it to come during all seasons to get a wonderful feel of the Pacific Northwest and all of its seasonal plants. The staff is very friendly and knowledgeable and took all the time to answer all of our questions
Was such a lovely day, had a peaceful walk around the grounds. Love this place!

First time visiting.  Didn't look at many things, but what I saw filled me with peace and contentment.  I ate my sandwich and rested in the shade of two beautiful trees as I waited for my doctor's appointment.  The volunteers and staff were kind and knowledgeable about the species of flowers and trees.  Wish I had the time to wait for more doctor's appointments there.

This is such a charming, historical place! I highly recommend going on a free house tour. The exhibits are constantly changing and they even hold high teas here every month. If you want to take a step back into time, definitely put Deepwood on your list.

name: Willamette Heritage Center
address: 1313 Mill St SE, Salem, OR 97301, USA
reviews: Went for the yarn store inside. They where closed despite the door and the desk saying they should be open. Really made me mad because i was so excited to go in and look. From the window it looked like they had some good colors and yarns but cant definitely say.

Nice little museum, interesting history and exhibits on pioneering missionaries around Salem and Marion county and the establishment of a textile mill there. There is some limited associated Native American history mostly in one area kind of pushed off to the side in the main building as I recall. You can go into several old buildings of the period on site (you'll get a key with your admission).  Also you can go into the textile mill building. If you want to see one of the old automated  looms in action and no staff are there, call the front desk on your cell and they'll send someone to turn it on (albeit briefly) for you to watch. I visited in November.

Loved our visit! I learned so much about the area and about the mill process. The tour had many interactive pieces which added to the experience. There is so much to see so give yourself time. We like to read all the signage and our visit took about 3 hours. Wonderful place to stop! Staff were very friendly. The shops were also fun to check out at the end.
This place is a wonderful event venue! Charm, character and history all wrapped up together! Lots of space - it can be configured easily to fit your needs.

This is a very interesting collection of buildings that are each a small museum on their own that tell about an early industry in Salem.  The early hydropower display is particularly interesting.  There is a holiday light display in season where various groups have demonstrations.  The garden scale railroad and blacksmith displays are favorites of mine.

name: OSH Musuem of Mental Health
address: 2669, 2600 Center St NE, Salem, OR 97301, USA
reviews: informative and interesting! I highly recommends stopping here if you're ever in Salem.  It costs $7 to get in and see the exhibits and walk the grounds. One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest was filmed here and there's amazing memorial outside (the copper cans). The staff are knowledgeable and friendly.

Went in today to see what changes and progression they have gained by making the historical, still standing part of the building a museum. 
Was very informative about mental health care and how far it has come in the last 100+ years. I was hoping they had more information on the museum building its self and the history it has been subjected to through the years but,  since only the front bottom nodule its limited. More information on this specific museums history would be great. $7 a pop for adults... Students are less. 

Dont forget to go see the memorial they situated for the forgotten urns that where discovered concreted into a "room".

They also left a lot out about the untold history of the building and "not so good" events. 

Overall.... Great host (thank you Bob), very informative about mental health history. Great displays,  time line is nice,  straight jacket was fantastic and the grounds are nice. Good for kids (that do not touch)!
Truly enjoyed learning how mental health treatment and views have changed throughout the years.
Cool and sad at the same time. Worth a quick stop to check it out

I found it a fascinating adventure! I love the fact that it was a self-guided tour and I could take as much, or as little, time as I wanted. I read a lot of the information there, as well as taking some pictures, to read information later, as there was so much. I'm really glad I did it, as were both of my friends that want with me!  Downside: limited available parking at times.

name: Oregon State Capitol
address: 900 Court St NE, Salem, OR 97301, USA
reviews: The grounds at this capitol building are more beautiful than any grounds I've seen elsewhere! There's so much grass to relax on and gorgeous rows of trees lining the fields. At the center of it all is a unique water fountain. The very best time to visit the capitol is in the spring. The flowers are blooming and the trees are in full blosom.  The inside of the capitol building is beautiful as well and fun to explore.

It was wonderful walking through the halls of power for the State of Oregon. I was most impressed with the Sergeant at Arms calling me over to sit with him as he explained to me the proceedings of the day since I arrived early and was wandering through. I was also able to witness the Senate opening ceremony including a poem by a local student and the Pledge of Allegiance. What struck me was every few minutes someone would yell out loudly into the hallway. At first I thought it was an emergency but seeing everyone else continue like normal I figured it must be a regular occurrence. I found out later that it was the job of pages to call the elected officials back into the chamber for votes. So a minute before the vote closes they run into the hall and yell out that it’s time to return and vote.

Visiting Salem and took the opportunity to visit the grounds of the State Capitol. Hadn't been here for a long time and it still is beautiful. I love the granite used in the construction of the buildings and also the architectural design. And what's not to like about the gold leaf statue on top? 👍

Beautiful Area but Oregon Lacks Proper Stewardship. Instead on kindling a Pioneering spirit inclined to prosperity. They trade that and feed the spirit dependency. We need to Help and assist the Retirement class and Truly disabled people.
It is worth visiting if you are near Salem. The Capitol building looks amazing from the outside. I didn't take the tour or go inside the building.

name: Honeywood Winery
address: 1350 Hines St SE, Salem, OR 97302, USA
reviews: Ordered some wine online as a gift to my friend who lives in Georgia. Her favorite wine is the raspberry, and it was a birthday present. I though maybe they would put a card that just said happen birthday, but instead the wrapped it in a bow and even filled the box with confetti! Definitely went above and beyond my expectations!! Will be ordering again!!
Friendly Staff. One if Portland's oldest Wineries

Fantastic experience. Large store with a great selection. All wines are available to taste with out any issues. Just ask. If you're from out of state you can pay to have your selected wine shipped to your residence.

Great winery! We have gone for wine tasting and went home with a few bottles. Loved everything we’ve tried. I went this evening to pick up some more wine and received excellent customer service yet again. Thanks

Went to here on the 29th and I loved the service I received. The worker was also named Crystal which I loved and she had great recommendations for me! Enjoyed the flight I did and learned about the third Friday events! Looking forward to coming to the next one.

Thank you for the wonderful wine and wonderful service other Crystal!

name: Cascades Gateway City Park
address: 2100 Turner Rd SE, Salem, OR 97302, USA
reviews: It's fun if you are just getting started fishing. Usually pretty well stocked with rainbow trout. A lot of geese activity though.

Fish the lake when they Stock it proves fun ! Watch the Osprey fish too they put on a great show ! Bring the kids fishing or pack a Picnic lunch & watch others fish ! Frisbee Golf coarse at this park as well & Keeps Your Dogs on Leash 😎

This is a very beautiful place to take a walk, and even though the county is working very hard to clean it up by cutting out the brush and over grown bushes so that the homeless cant hide there; I still wouldn't suggest walking it alone, or at least with out a dog and some pepper spray, or some sort of protection! The water path though is remarkable for picture taking! Enjoy and be safe!

The park is great in the summer and you can take a dip in the creek.
They also have a nine hole disc golf course but I haven't personally used it.
Just a lot of fisherman and the trails aren't great.  Looks like a decent disc golf course though. Just not really a place to get your steps in.

name: The Peter Courtney Minto Island Bridge
address: 230 Front St SE, Salem, OR 97301, USA
reviews: Very nice bridge for walking. Offers great views of the river and parts of downtown. Good access from downtown river front to minto Brown park and nature.

Sunday - July 21, 2019.  Salem's high daytime temperature was 83* and  plenty of folks were enjoying the great views from this bridge at sunset.  I love riding the bicycle trails in Minto Brown Island Park and remember the days prior to the Summer of 2016 when Riverfront Park did not have this amazing walking, biking, rollerblading and skateboarding connection with the largest park in Salem, Oregon (1205 acres).  Highly Recommended this great venue to all your family, friends / neighbors - and especially folks visiting Salem and the Willamette Valley.  *****Ten Stars*****

Beautiful bridge to have a quick walk Into mento brown. Or park in mento brown and bike across it to enjoy a nice croissant from cascade bakery across the street. Very beautiful views of the river Bend and worth the a little walk over.
A surprising modern bridge next to the water front
Beautiful pedestrian bridge

name: Salem Art Association - Bush Barn Art Center
address: 600 Mission St SE, Salem, OR 97302, USA
reviews: Lovely display of artwork and locally made items. The desk representative was helpful and polite. This is where you buy the Bush House Tour tickets. Great place to find a unique or special gift for someone. They have everything from yard art, cards, jewelry, kitchenware and decorative items. There is a small Park located near by with a drinking fountain and picnic tables. :-)

A great place to see art of artists doing their work.  This is the work of one my favorite artist that is doing his work during his residency. Roberto Oran. Great talent. Here is a video of how it looks inside. Come in and enjoy this art in salem Oregon
Very interesting place to go loved it my daughter put her artwork in there people very polite and the history of that Park is amazing highly recommend it to anybody

Excellent show I've ever seen for public viewing. Beautiful setting in park and very clean and neat. Art works were original and not copies.  Some were better than others.  Jewelry prices were a little inflated, but that comes as a personal opinion.  People were friendly and vendors were helpful . Easy access for wheelchairs and people could wander through exhibits at their leisure.  Food vendors available, but I didn't try. Nice place with the family. Wish they did it more often.
My step mother handles most of the lovely events and she does a fabulous job.

name: Wallace Marine Park Softball
address: 200 Glen Creek Rd NW, Salem, OR 97304, USA
reviews: It's a great park to walk your dogs. They put in new trails and have taken out a lot of blackberry bushes. The ball fields looked the same as always but we didn't really visit them this time.

It's a great place to go and right on the river too. If you go to go swimming,  there are lots if rocks so have water shoes or strong feet. They had bathrooms and some picnic tables. The nearby park was nice, too. A company Woodward surf company had kayaks for rent there, I didn't do them but will next time!

Aside from the bulldozed tent troll dope mess, trails were expanded from the previous years and improved access to ponds. Nice people though. But unleashed dogs in unfenced campsites. Let them be. Change their dope.
The same park I always had fond memories of growing up.   Swim area looks different and train bridge is now a pedestrian path (love it) but still a great place.
Fields were SO clean and well maintained.

name: Keizer Rapids Park
address: 1900 Chemawa Rd N, Keizer, OR 97303, USA
reviews: Great trail! Huge dog park. Nice play structures. River access when it isn't flooded. The hike is partially shaded, so excellent for people who want to avoid the sun or just stay a bit cooler A great place for a quick hike with puppies!
Great park. The 5 and under section is so important with how many visit the park. Paved path is great for kids to ride on. There is also a dog park and beach volleyball across the way.

best park ever! kids playground is so fun and fenced in so you can let them run and be Independent  plus there is no busy road nearby like Bush park for example where the kids could take off to quickly(all.parents know you just have to look away for a half a second and anything can happen) here I dont have to be anxious the entire time about imminent danger(note: I am far far from being helicopter mom but these things still freak me out) we can just have fun and play!!

This is the best time of year for Keizer rapids disc golf... For not losing discs in the woods. You might want to skip hole 12 if you don't have a boat. It would be nice if the baskets had bright flags or top rims.

So much to do here! Upon entrance is the big dog park attached is the little dog park. The Big Toy playground is across from the sand volleyball courts. Beautiful trails to walk; some paved some unpaved. Access to the boat ramp is down the drive plus additional parking! Plenty of benches to rest any weary bones! Many friendly people stop and say hi!!

name: Powerland Heritage Park - Antique Powerland
address: 3995 Brooklake Rd NE, Salem, OR 97303, USA
reviews: Please take your children & family this will open eyes to look back and see what a Grandpa or great Grandpa did to raise crops or build machinery whichever the case please go and take the time to visit. There is so much to see and touch and the stories that the old timers tell of is worth it in itself. I've been going for a long time and it never ceases to amaze. Like I said it's a blast your children will love it!
I have been coming here for years and I love the changes and the improvements that they have done it really brings the old into the new thank you for everyone who has participated
Went to the steam/ equipment show, there was so much to look at and enjoy about the machines our forefathers used to farm, log, etc. Took a full day to see it all! Well done!!

We did a tour and the staff did an amazing job of explaining any questions we had. They have 14 different museums, everything from large trucks, classic cars, train and Trolley museum. It's definitely worth seeing. I know young boys would absolutely love it. It's family friendly and can also picnic on the grounds.

Fabulous place to visit if you love history and antiques. Great collection of antique tractors, trucks, cars, motorcycles. Loved riding the old trolley and viewing the old-time sawmill. My husband and I spent about 6 hrs here just looking around and enjoying the past.

name: Hallie Ford Museum of Art
address: 700 State St, Salem, OR 97301, USA
reviews: It was sadly empty when we went (sad because this little museum has some great stuff and deserves more attention, though fun to have an entire art museum to ourselves!) But the staff was lovely and helpful and they had some very cool pieces and exhibits. Worth a visit.
Thoroughly enjoyed the current exhibits as well as the permanent collections. Excellent museum with great art pieces and well laid out.
This is a wonderful museum. I initially visited in October 2019. I shall return.
Allowed our sketching group to spend time there. Wonderful museum, really loved the native exhibit

Really enjoyed visiting this little museum( felt a lot like a gallery) Permanent exhibits of ancient artifacts, coins,icons, eastern and western were a happy surprise. Downstairs modern Oregon artist works on display. Very nice, small but wonderfully curated, gift shop. Enjoyed my,stumbled upon it , visit! Visited after the Cherry Blossom Festival at the Capitol which just happened to fall on a free admission day.. My granddaughter really enjoyed the interactive exhibits

name: Bryan Johnston Park
address: 400 Mildred Ln SE, Salem, OR 97306, USA
reviews: This is a great spot for the kiddos or the dogs or the Pokemon trainers. The playground is very modern with a play structure suitable for five and younger as well as some very entertaining modern moving play structures for the older kids. Lots of spinning toys. With a fairly large sized hillside and walking path, the park is excellent for dogs. Picnic tables and a small basketball court complete this great neighborhood attraction.

This is a great place for the little ones like infant walkers and toddler aged even up to maybe age 5 but the bigger kid section is just that set up for older aged kids. I feel like it leaves out the in-between ages from 6-9 where they aren't big yet and yet are not small. Sometimes this park can feel over crowded really easy. I have a 7 year old and she has a hard time having fun here due to the limit of activities and play structures she is even limited to those as well.
It’s a neat park for kids. I love the view of the mountains when the sky is clear.

This is what a great neighborhood park looks like. The addition of a vault toilet would increase this to a 5⭐ park.

If you're an adult, I suggest you stay away from the playground equipment in the photo... I was spinning so fast on this thing once, I almost lost my lunch 🤢 I dont think it's designed for grown men. But my 3 y/o niece had a laugh, so it was worth it ¯\_(ツ)_/¯
Great cute park quite quaint. Good for kids and dogs

name: Orchard Heights Park
address: 1165 Orchard Heights Rd NW, Salem, OR 97304, USA
reviews: Nice park. Big dog park is up trail nice big field surrounded by trees but not fenced.
Nice park with loads of wild rabbits hopping around.
Great place to just walk or jog on the trails. There's a kids playground, two baseball fields, some tennis courts, and dog friendly area where you can let you pooch of the leash. Lots of parking too.
Great place to take the kids to play. Has a nice nature trail as well.
Nice place to do sports, bike, fly planes/drones, and just hang out.

name: Coria Estates
address: 8252 Redstone Ave SE, Salem, OR 97306, USA
reviews: Absolutely gorgeous views. I love their seating arrangements outside. Very relaxing atmosphere. One of my favorite winerys by far. Wine is delicious, the staff does a great explanation on each one
Beautiful location and great staff, but their wines were brutally acidic even for the Willamete Valley, and bit forgettable. If you go bring food to preserve your palate.
The wine has improved. The wine tasting area is a spectacular improvement over their old one. The music was perfect. The weather was gorgeous. Sharing it all with a friend made it all so much better.

This is a hard post to write....my first experience here was very decent....it was late 2018 and my wife and I stopped in to try some wine early one morning.  The selection was limited but we left with three bottles and a smile.... memorial day weekend 2019 on the other hand....same selection of wines but expanded.....as the new vintage had yet to be bottled....and we left after a short bit having felt the tasting fee was a waste.....whatever happened over the winter needs attention....

Fantastic experience all around!  Myself, my boyfriend, and a good friend all went for the Memorial Day event and loved it!  My boyfriend isn't much of a wine person but still loved the views, service , and live music.  The biggest thing that made this vineyard stand out was that it's dog friendly.  We sat in the grass looking over the hills while enjoying our tasting, all the while not having to leave our furry best friend home! I'm now looking into their wine club!
5/5 - would recommend

name: The Oregon Garden
address: 879 W Main St, Silverton, OR 97381, USA
reviews: We actually went to the restaurant at the hotel that sits above the Oregon Garden (Oregon Garden Resort & Spa). Husband and I were late for lunch and early for dinner service, so we tried the pub there. The pub is comfy, big fireplace in middle, nice bar, good beer, and food is yummy like the restaurant but with a more limited bar menu. Had the Hop Valley ale (lighter, very smooth beer) - really liked it! Also ordered the steak tacos. A little spicy, garlicky, and very generous serving of 3 tacos. Husband had popcorn shrimp and a Caesar salad. The salad looked delicious - individual cloves of roasted garlic, bacon, etc. He thought the shrimp were a little over cooked, but overall quite good. I really liked the bar. Service was quick, server very pleasant and attentive. Will be back! Really like the setting, the restaurant, and now the pub.

What an amazing Garden. This place is beautiful and well maintained. I visited while the magnolias were in bloom and was pleasantly surprised by the variety of early season blooms I was able to enjoy while having the whole garden nearly to myself. I would have liked to have spent more time enjoying the garden and will definitely be going back for another visit ASAP.

Beautiful garden and it is large enough to take hours to look around the whole area. There are couple small trails to take as well. Just make sure you are coming after fall, otherwise most areas will be not fully blossomed yet.

Very nice weekend and we will definitely return:
Food: We didn't eat in the restaurant but had happy hour in the lounge and it was nice. Breakfast was very good, everything fresh. Good coffee.
The room: Nice, not luxurious but quite comfortable and very quiet. Bed not the best and bring you own pillows. The room was clean and quiet.
The garden: outstanding. Everything maintained well, pleasing to the eye and even the ear. Well worth the time and price of admission. Having it included with the room added value.
Tour tram: Wild Bill was our driver and we really liked him, he was very pleasant and informative, he made it a real treat. The tram tour gave a wonderful overview of the garden that made us want to explore.
All in all a great experience we would recommend highly.

A delightful day spent strolling through the gardens, enjoying a family meal at the provided picnic tables, and learning so much about the history of the Garden. I highly recommend a visit. Mobility issues can be alleviated by the shuttle service within the grounds.

name: Willamette Valley Vineyards
address: 8800 Enchanted Way SE, Turner, OR 97392, USA
reviews: Superb vineyard with tastings and excellent menu of appetizers and entries in the Willamette Valley.  They offer a large selection of varietals from around the valley and in nearby AVAs (as far as Walla Walla). Private tours are available by appointment for members, and are well worth it. Every wine we tasted here was fantastic.

I love this place! Such a great view of the valley, and a nice place to catch up with loved ones. Their flights are a great way to try several types of wine and find a new favorite. I also love that the bottles are reasonably priced. All I’ve ordered food wise is the fries - which were tasty for sure! I did love the tualatin semi-sparkling muscat, I’m more of a white wine girl and it was sweet like peaches. The staff was prompt and courteous (though I would love the option to bus my own table). Sarah was our server, super friendly and easy to talk to :)

Amazing experience! Not only is the wine and food delicious but the customer service was outstanding. Brian went above and beyond to ensure that we had a great time and we definitely did. He was knowledgeable, attentive, and all around his customer service was top notch. The views are also breathtaking. We will definitely be back

My friends and I had a great time touring this vineyard and I would definitely urge people to go on the tasting tour. It took us about 2 hours and was decently prices for getting wine tastings as well as cheese and almonds.  The stories on the tour were great and our guide, Tori, was very personable. I would highly recommend the wine as well as they had wine for all our varying tastes! The dessert Riesling was the biggest hit for our group as well.
We are staying in the lower suite and did the tour yesterday with Victoria.  Wow...we love it here. Spectacular views, amazing service, and beautiful wine! Highly recommend a visit here.

name: Bethel Heights Vineyard
address: 6060 Bethel Heights Rd NW, Salem, OR 97304, USA
reviews: Jan 2020 My friends and visited Bethel Heights for group wine tasting! Awesome wine great view and cozy spot for tasting! Before our arrival Kate build us a roaring fire! Kate is very knowledgeable about their wines. Thank you so much Kate, for a GREAT visit! Definitely recommend!

Had an awesome tasting experience the other day with Kate. The wines were delicious and views of the property are exceptional. It’s cool to learn about the ways they’re managing the vineyards on site. I will definitely be recommending this winery

Stunningly beautiful view of wine country from this high up winery. Classy tasting room, fabulously decorated, and always warm and welcoming. Fantastic wines. You will be so happy you made the trip to this winery.
Supporters of cap & trade,  never again will we ever buy any of your products,  let me know how that works out for ya mini Casteel.. Chow
Great tasting experience 100% Pinot Noir grapes and the entire selection is vinified from their local estate. Most of the vines are 40+ years old and dry-farmed.

name: Oregon Electric Railway Museum
address: Salem, OR 97303, USA
reviews: Really fun!

They are having the Great Steam Up and Quilt Show this weekend Aug 4th and 5th.

Powerland Heritage Park has over 10 museums with tons of oldtime moble vehicles of all kinds. 
This includes various types of tractors. It is all volunteer run.
Family fun! Several museums!
Yearly trip to the steam up...Amazing weekend!
Love this place.

name: Waldo Park
address: 605 Summer St NE, Salem, OR 97310, USA
reviews: It's, a beautiful, stroll by the, Creek Around, The State Lands Building. Very, clean.

If you fancy yourself a great place to walk around for those pokemon. Here's the park for you. Perfect location for gyms and stops. Tons of friendly people who are willing to play with you. Enjoy and good luck

Historic Bethabara Park is a wonderful piece of history near Winston-Salem. The buildings are well maintained and have excellent tours & guides. The Visitor's Center is modern, well-maintained, and used for educational meetings. They have a nice little gift shop too! There are special community events scheduled almost every month of the year, geared for families and kids. Their heirloom herb garden is one of the best in the Southeast. They maintain a website to keep the community up-to-date. My personal favorites are the Summer evening concerts and the Highland Scottish Games!

I love how small this park is because it has been created to honor a humbling tree planted over one hundred years ago. I respect that Salem, Oregon had space that was set aside to protect and preserve the tree. The 'Where's Waldo" jokes may begin!
It's a nice little patch of land with a beautiful Sequoia that provides excellent shade for a quick rest on the bench nearby. Not only that but it's also a Pokéstop!

name: St. Innocent Winery
address: 10052 Enchanted Way SE, Jefferson, OR 97352, USA
reviews: Went to this charming spot for the first time on Friday. Had a lovely experience wine-tasting! Alec was very attentive and informative about the various varietals. The wine was very enjoyable and reasonably priced, they even offer half-bottles. So glad they moved to south Salem as the area needs more wineries. Looking forward to returning!
The new tasting room is open! Beautiful patio and room.

Incredible Pinot Noirs, beautiful tasting room and grounds! Lovely staff - Michelle was so nice and knowledgeable. Loved that they offered some food: delicious homemade Cassoulet (French bean soup) and bread. It was just perfect!
Had a wonderful glass of wine here and enjoyed the calm atmosphere. Bill was so friendly and very helpful as well. Highly recommended!

Did a wine tasting and lunch with 12 people or so and could not have had a better experience.  These people really care about their wines and their service.  The prices are reasonable.  The experience was personable and genuine.  Go here and enjoy!!

name: Cristom Vineyards
address: 6905 Spring Valley Rd NW, Salem, OR 97304, USA
reviews: This was our very first winery during our trip to Oregon, and it was an amazing introduction to Oregon wines. Holly was a fantastic person to take us through our wine tasting, and she was so personable and friendly. She is very knowledgeable about wine, and we learned so much about Oregon wines and Cristom. We enjoyed the wines at Cristom so much that we left with several bottles to enjoy back home. This winery was still our favorite even after visiting several others in the area.

Our first visit to Oregon vinyards and this was our absolute favorite for the selections.  Not a spectacular view unless you enjoy a view of the beautiful vinyards.  But are you looking for a special view or fabelous wine?  We can't just visit the vinyard from over here in Florida but we have ordered 5 cases of Rose and Pinot Gris and have thoroughly enjoyed them..  very knowledgable staff and everyone is super friendly.  If you're out this way definatly one not to miss.

I can highly recommend a visit to Cristom, known for its whole cluster 
fermentation, low staff turnover rate and outstanding wine/
winemaker, Steve. Many people have been there for over 25 years!
Julie and Darcy love working there, and it shows. They speak very 
highly of Steve, and his old world style. Both ladies were very knowledgable, yet down to Earth and engaging. Julie was a lot of
fun and made the entire experience a blast. The views are lovely and
you will have a wonderful experience too.Thanks, ladies! Elizabeth
Best wine in Willamette valley by far

I LOVE Cristom. I love their wine. Dustin was probably a HUGE factor in us joining the wine club. He is SO knowledgeable, funny, friendly and he has the same palate for wine that I do. I have NEVER EVER had bad wine here. Cristom is more upscale than a lot of other vineyards in their pricing. They don't offer you a tasting OR a glass of wine as a member, and I understand why they don't want to cheapen the tasting room experience, but it will pinch the purse a bit more to make it a pop in for a glass if you're a member. I haven't yet gone to any of the member events, but I am really looking forward to it. This wine will not disappoint you, be prepared to pay for it though because it is GOOD wine.

name: Pacific Northwest Truck Museum
address: 3995 Brooklake Rd NE, Salem, OR 97303, USA
reviews: If you love old trucks, the history of trucks or anything else about trucks you need to go!
Beautifully restored vehicles, steam powered behemoths, models, antiques...this place has it all.
Visited during the Brooks truck show. This place is very nice, and has some beautiful historical trucks inside the museum. Very clean, and lots of nice people. I would visit again.
MASSIVE collection of trucks, some over 100 years old. Incredible history you can walk up to and see.

Family of four with kids age 8 and 10 and we had a fantastic time! The kids surprised me by being really into it and wanting selfies with almost all the vehicles. 

The volunteers were not only engaging they were extremely outgoing making it a great customer service experience. We got a guided tour by an expert on the collection and we learned so much! 

The park of museums/collections has dozens of attractions and we got in for 10 bucks, ate packed lunches and spent a little more on optional activities.

We can't wait to go again!

name: Hanson Vineyards
address: 34948 S Barlow Rd, Woodburn, OR 97071, USA
reviews: Family and kid friendly, big yard with games.  Affordable wines and generous for $10 flight sample.
Loved the rural feel and intimate atmosphere. Great small family winery. Don't pass by!

Found this gem via Google and decided to check it out. The location is lovely, lots of outdoor seating with picturesque views. All 6 wines we tasted were delicious, I came home with 3 bottles. Highly recommend for sure!
We love this place. It's amazing. Great visit with the wine grower and large variety of wines that are all excellent.
Mr Hanson is a wonderful, knowledgeable host who makes clean, honest wines.

name: Salem's Riverfront Carousel
address: 101 Front St NE, Salem, OR 97301, USA
reviews: Awesome place,  great place to take kids.  They accommodate people and children with special needs or disabilities, even offer free ride tickets. Super friendly staff who are honest good hearted people

What’s not to love about this carousel? Great people working there. We tend to get popcorn and cotton candy. But of course the main attraction is the carousel, with its painstakingly crafted horses, the occasional giraffe, cow, frog, etc., seem to the kids to have personalities. We stop in regularly when we are in the area and come to visit for events, like Santa Claus arriving by train.
The gift shop has brilliant buyers and is always a good place to get just the right present.
The playground outside is a nice treat too, and it’s right on the Willamette river.

The people running the carousel were extremely friendly and put my skittish son at ease. It was open past any other kid friendly to-do in the area and was inexpensive as well. Because it was indoors we were able to escape the cold weather, and the carousel was beautiful and well maintained.

There are beautiful hand-carved horses and other animals to ride on the carousel. The facility is clean and safe for children and people with developmental disabilities. They have a special ramp for people in wheelchairs to get on the carousel. And, there's a special place for them to ride. It's very thoughtful and inclusive for all!
Salem's best attraction.  Fun and inexpensive.  Go on a nice day and enjoy Riverfront park as well.

name: Gaiety Hollow
address: 545 Mission St SE, Salem, OR 97301, USA
reviews: Attended a  lovely Botanical Painting workshop with Jeanne Debon, here, during Spring 2019. Super lovely hosting of our group, beautiful spaces, and pleasant, happy times!! Thank you!  Here is my Allium flower I was so proud to paint!!!

Loved learning about all the historic renovation going on, and move about the two amazing early landscape architects and the important role they played in the northwest! Can't wait to watch how this garden changes over time.
Beautiful grounds! Would highly recommend.

This is the loveliest place you've never heard of. Most definitely worth the drive from Portland. This is the personal gardens and home of landscape architects Lord & Schryver. The gardens are slowly and carefully being curated and restored to their original glory. Although the garden is a work in progress, it's beautiful to see anytime. For a nominal fee you can see the ground floor of their lovely but modest home. There are framed garden plans drawn by the designers themselves. They are really works of art and very interesting to see. There is a short talk that was very informative and well done. You get a piece of Oregon history that many haven't heard! These two trailblazing and entrepreneurial woman started their firm in 1929 after the market crashed! Their story will make you want to find out more!

This is a display garden that was designed by Lord & Schryver. They were the first women-owned landscape design business in this area back in the 1930s. they designed the gardens around Deepwood, Bush Park, North Salem High School, and this home among many many others. Volunteers lovingly maintain this garden and it is worth that or if you are into gardens.

name: Evergreen Aviation & Space Museum
address: 500 NE Captain Michael King Smith Way, McMinnville, OR 97128, USA
reviews: Place is awesome. So much to do and in with the family. I have a 4 year old that loves space and rockets and he always has a blast. There are some of the interactive exhibits weren't functional but there are so many that you could find one that did. It's not overpriced and you can easily spend hours here including a choice of movie with admission. The Spruce Goose or Hercules is awesome and the people running that exhibit are full of fun facts.

Home of the spruce goose. Military and civilian aircraft and aerospace museum. The displays were exceptionally well done and even the buildings are architectural wonders. I was very excited about my visit and we'll go there someday when I am back out in Oregon. I would highly recommend the evergreen aviation & space museum to anybody having an interest in aviation space and history
We had a great visit! The director was engaged and engaging during our tour of the Spruce Goose. Plenty of things you are allowed to touch. Can't wait to go back to see the space side.

Not a cheap play day for families, but the Annual Passes are well worth it for multiple visits &/or visitors. One visit may not suffice, because there is a LOT to see. Aviation buffs will love it. The building housing the Howard Hughs Flying Boat has many other aircraft, as well as displays of engines, propellers, flight history developments and personal stories of key events in aviation. There is a super gift shop,  children's play area & suitable grill for a burger, chili & beer. Lots of monitors with genuine footage. The volunteer staff is solicitous and the restrooms are large and clean. There is a second building across the parking lot dedicated to rocketry which is every bit as thorough in its displays, and provides a neat walk through of the major events of mankind's expanding exploration into space. Not just the equipment, but the stories of the individuals who developed and rode said are chronicled. There is a theater between the two which has ongoing showings of different aviation related documentaries. The grounds have perhaps another 20 aircraft, and are well groomed. This is a full day museum visit (if not 2), and one which merits sharing with out of town guests on a family pass.

Seeing the Spruce Goose in person was on my bucket list, it was mesmerizing. There aren’t words to describe how absolutely amazing it was to see in person I was in complete AHHH of it. It was ginormous, even bigger than you’re imagining reading this. My husband is military so we got in for free so that was wonderful too. I also loved looking around at all of the other airplanes and outfits they wore on the planes it really takes you back in time and you feel like you were there. This was such an amazing experience

name: Santana Village Park
address: 850 Shawnee Dr SE, Salem, OR 97317, USA
reviews:
This park seems to be well maintained. It is kept up by volunteers on the neighborhood. Depending on the time of day this park can be a place of solitude. During summer break and in the late afternoon and evening there are usually others there. When I went today about 1 o clock, there was no one but myself there. 
This park offers a walking path, baseball diamond, picnic tables, a basketball and tennis court as well as playground equipment and swings. There is also porta-potty stationed near the basketball court.

Play area is way too small. Kinda takes away from the word 'park'.  & the head "neighborhood watch" guy is way too weird. He approaches kids and tells them not to play for too much longer. & bugs the adults and threatens to call the police if you're there too long for his liking. Happened to me 4 times.
Is not what it used to be. Trash everywhere. Soppy mess. Unkempt.
Great neightborhood park. Owned and run by neighbors. Enhances the value of the community.
Nice little park nothing too special

name: Mt Angel Oktoberfest
address: Box 1054, 5 N Garfield St, Mt Angel, OR 97362, USA
reviews: I've been going to this festival since I was a baby. It's had over 125 years to perfect itself into the best Oktoberfest on the West Coast. It's all non profit, so you are getting good food and supporting schools and churches and other charities. Finally, while the fest halls require wristbands for entry (small cover charge) the Kindergarten for the children is free. Free rides, free shows, free face painting, free pony rides. The whole event is spectacularly put on from start to finish. Don't forget to stick around for the street dance at the bandstand every evening! There's a married couple that's been teaching and leading the street dance for over 20 years! Absolutely worth a visit with kids or not!

The Oktoberfest is an event that you should experience at least once in your life, if not every year. The food is great and there are so many choices that everyone will be happy.  There is a huge Kindergarten for the kids to play, and lots of craft booths, heritage point of interest, and bands for the adults. Oh, did I mention the beer?

Fun for the whole family. Multiple beer gardens to choose from to get out of the sun and rest while listening to classic songs and some surprising "polka covers" of modern pop. I was amazed at how many blocks filled with vendors there were.

This festival is amazing.  Lots of culture and great food.  Layout is well done.  It is organized and efficient.  Despite large crowds there was never a long wait for anything.  All of the volunteers were pleasant and well trained.  I enjoyed myself and can't wait for 2020

My once a year birthday stop.  Love the food carts that make it feel like a buffet of marvelous choices.  Cinnamon rolls for breakfast, cabbage roll for lunch, dough boys or elephant ears for desert.  Pure delight.  Gotta love the entertainment, the atmosphere, and the food, but most of all, IT'S THE GRAPEFRUIT BEER!!!  I can only hope that it will be on tap in heaven!!!

name: Baskett Slough National Wildlife Refuge
address: 10995 Oregon 22, Dallas, OR 97338, USA
reviews: Not the best park for kids, no play structures, And most of the time it's, well, its a Slough. 5 stars for its beauty. You can come to the main rest area off the highway and take in this pristine and vast open space, or you can travel farther West and find a back road that leads to the middle of the slough. A wonderful place to nature watch.

There isn't anything that is a real WOW about it. But the area is pretty and there are always lots of birds to see. Mainly waterfowl. 

It used to be a great spot to stop for a little break when driving to the coast. There's never a ton of people and a couple picnic tables, but they tore out the pit toilets years ago and never replaced them. Not even a porta potty.
Breathtakingly beautiful every step of the way. Great for short open ares hikes or with small kids.

Wait for migration time, exquisite sunsets, many species. Some great places to set up your camera without disturbing anyone. Lots of water, some swampy. Beavers, foxes,  herons, birds of prey, mergansers, shockers and more. Traffic is respectful to this nature sanctuary, a pit stop on the migratory path.
Gorgeous, not crowded. Thousands of birds. Bring your long lenses.

name: Frank Lloyd Wright Gordon House
address: 869 W Main St, Silverton, OR 97381, USA
reviews: Loved the history of this place. Fabulous architecture. To be able to see a home designed by Frank Lloyd Wright was a dream come true for me. I am so thankful this great home was saved. Definitely worth the fee for this great tour.

I did not get to take the tour. The house looks amazing from the outside. Peeking into the windows, the house looks amazing inside. It's amazing to think that these house designs we're considered economical. Today they seem so forward & modern.
The tour is a must see. What a wonderful example of Wright's Usonian houses. The docent was warm and knowledgeable. We loved it.
Twenty dollars per person is too high to go in, but the grounds were beautiful.

Must see for FLW fans and architecture buffs. Make reservations online for one of the 1 hour tours as there is no guarantee they can fit you in if you just walk up. Only example of FLW’s work in Oregon.

name: Dallas City Park
address: 266 SW Academy St, Dallas, OR 97338, USA
reviews: Very nice disk golf course. 18 holes and nice park, lots of trees too. Easy to find and worth the visit.

Such a wonderful park and definitely the place to be on the weekends with so much going on. I used to go crawdad fishing here as a kid and it's nice to see that's still popular. 

There's disc golf with some small biking trails going through the course which is a lot of fun. There's covered areas with large tables, plenty of restrooms and parking, and it's connected to the arboretum -- which you should walk through because it's wonderful too!

Plus the new waterfront path is beautiful! I can't wait until that path connects to the other part of town.

Nice spacious park with a great frisbee golf course and nice combination of open spaces and wooded or shrubbery areas. The garden is pretty neat and the creek flowing through is beautiful and not a bad place for kids to play or cool off on hot days. This park has a lot to offer.
I absolutely love the trails of this park! My two year old never get bored. Theres a couple play grounds and a lot of places to explore.

The Dallas City Park is Stunning! One of it's kind! A must see when visiting Dallas Oregon. 
There are 4 entrances for vehicles. Basketball hoops at the parking lot at Walnut and Levens streets w/ Horseshoe pits on opposite side.
Entry there leads into the park where there are 2 more parking areas.
 There's a walking bridge conjoining the parks 2 sides.
 The Rickreal Creek winds it's beautiful way through the cottonwood trees with walking Trails surrounding and along side the creek.
 You'll find covered picnic areas w/BBQ grills, electrical outlets and Kitchen sinks. 2 Gazebos, 1 has a Fire Place. Picnic tables and bbqs are scattered throughout. 
There's an arboretum.
Also there's displays inside of local insects, moths and butterflies. 
As you walk the trails, there are informative kiosks with history of our area and its native people and plants.

Popular for it's year round Frisbee Golf course & for the
 Annual events held the final weekend in July - "Art in the Park", "Breakfast in the Park" and a Car Show, The Dallas City Park brings people here to compete, compare, & share. 
When all that excitement is passed we still have the playgrounds, the beauty & the serenity that our city park has always offered. I hope you'll at least check it out if u find yourself in Dallas Oregon, enjoy!  : )

name: Redhawk Vineyard & Winery
address: 2995 Michigan City Ln NW, Salem, OR 97304, USA
reviews: I've always enjoyed my visits for wine tasting and events at Redhawk. I highly recommend!
Beautiful view and great wine!
The estate wines are very good.
All of the wines were delicious and the staff was friendly and inviting.
Incredible views, great wines.

name: Ankeny Vineyards & Winery
address: 2565 Riverside Dr S, Salem, OR 97306, USA
reviews: The wine flight showcased a wide range of wines. I loved two of the six, and the other four were pretty good. The hummus plate was really great, as was the pizza! The tasting room is small, and can get loud if there are lots of people. It was chilly when we were there yesterday. They have a wood stove but didn't seem to be using it. They have outdoor seating with heaters as well. The road it overlooks is pretty quiet, so it seems like it'd be a nice space to sit, but we were too chilled to do that.

We had a lovely visit. We did a wine tasting and had two pizzas. Everything was absolutely delicious 😋! We left with a delicious bottle of chocolate port, and plan on having a wonderful dessert in the near future 🍧🍷. After our meal we walked along the beautiful grounds. It was definitely worth the (scenic) drive.

Beautiful place, great wine tasting and food was delicious. We truly enjoyed our afternoon. 
The brick oven Pizza was delicious and you must try the dessert chocolate 🍷 wine. Omg I never tasted anything some Yummy. 
Services is a little slow, however she was super friendly and we weren’t in any rush.
Very quaint tasting room but extremely friendly staff members. Love the views and look forward to visit in the summer to enjoy the patio.
A beautiful farm with fantastic wood fire pizza.

name: Delbert Hunter Arboretum and Botanical Garden
address: Dallas, OR 97338, USA
reviews: All the trails loop back around, there are multiple benches to hang out at, there are 2 benches overlooking the river, a gazebo, a rock garden, a little mini waterfall, and they seem to have things being worked on all the time by volunteers. It's kid friendly, dog friendly, and my daughter and I love taking snacks like a picnic. People clean up their trash and doggy messes. It's safe and next to the Dallas City Park. Also, people paint rocks and hide them. Join in for the fun!
It's such a beautiful place. You can swim in the river which is just relaxing.
Pretty! It reminds me of some of that the places I go near Packwood, Wa.
Nice little walking trails, and rock hunting!
One of the reasons the Dallas City Park is stunning and so beautiful is this Gem.

name: Eola Hills Wine Cellars
address: 501 S Pacific Hwy W, Rickreall, OR 97371, USA
reviews: Love this place, but really miss the Sunday and Valentines Day buffet they used to offer. It was the best!

We parked in our RV at this location. We enjoyed a tasting and Sunday brunch. The Pinot noir was my favorite, my partner the merlot.
The staff was helpful. The koi pond was so peaceful. I'm glad we stayed here.

Legacy Estate is such a beautiful place. We have enjoyed the concert series & weddings held there. We have been to both tasting rooms & had great experiences. We aren’t wine club members but still are treated with respect.

Spent the night in our RV.  The TEMPRANILLO was wonderful.  Nice body and richness.  The winery has done a great job setting up little places for guests to sit and enjoy their wines.  The sunset was amazing if you can be there when they are open that late.  The only thing annoying was the deer bombs but of course, in this part of the world without them there'd be no wine.  We'd HIGHLY recommend Eola!
Friendly staff, large tasting room and complimentary tastings! Really enjoyed the pinot noir and the raspberry dessert wine.

name: Enchanted Forest
address: 8462 Enchanted Way SE, Turner, OR 97392, USA
reviews: This place is amazing my kids absolutely love it and it's great for the whole family definitely bring something for lunch because food there is a little outrageous. Admission isn't too bad. It's a lot of fun and makes great childhood memories

The best thing in Salem, Oregon is not even in town... it's just outside of city limits on I-5, no matter who you are you'll find something to smile about at this family owned & operated unique theme park. A hooded sweatshirt from this place is worn like a badge of honor among locals, to show their culture to those in the know of this hidden gem just off the highway. RIP Thrillville, but the forest continues to enchant!

So much fun here! The whole family had a great time exploring and riding the rides. We enjoyed the attractions and entertainment. The whole experience was just a little bit magical. Kids and adults alike had fun. In all honesty bringing a child does make it even more fun. Food was good, price was decent, parking was easy.

Fun, a little creepy in some areas (see online stories of the haunted house that is reported to be actually haunted), and some of the attractions are even a bit goofy, but still worth the trip and price of admission for kids young and old.  Plenty of fun rides, lots of typical food offerings, quaint paths with beautiful old growth shade trees (the park is nestled into a mountainside that rests beneath a lush, full forest canopy), benches and picnic tables. My favorites include the Western town and whimsical characters displayed throughout the different themes within the park. The Enchanted Forest is an Oregon landmark and icon, if not adorable oddity.

This place is fantastic. If you are visiting that state this is a must go. It's fun for everyone. Kids or not. The employees are kind and helpful. I've been coming here annually since I was a kid. Kids love the slides and the carousel.

name: Bells Up Winery
address: 27895 NE Bell Rd, Newberg, OR 97132, USA
reviews: One of the best wine tastings we went to in Willamette Valley. Dave was friendly and very knowledgeable. He had some of the best wines we tasted during our week long visit to Oregon. If you like fine wine and a boutique winery this is for you. By appointment only.

First I want to say this a new winery! I was very impressed with Bells Up Winery. This winery was easy to find. You won't believe this! When me and my clients made the turn up to the winery, the owner David Specter was waiting for us outside smiling and he was very happy to see us! I love the positive energy that was given to us! David told us about the history of the property and the winery! The wine was amazing! I believe this winery can compete with any WINERIES in this industry! I HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS WINERY!

Wonderful stop for my wife and I along our Pinot tour of Willamette Valley! Dave is a great guy who is passionate about his vineyard and Super knowledgeable! Was ecstatic to be able to have a tasting with the actually winemaker and was able to learn so much about the process and wines!
Dave was so awesome! Not every tasting does the winemaker himself pour for you and share his knowledge and passion for growing grapes and making wine. Thanks so much!
What an awesome experience to have David the winemaker give us the tasting and tour. I really appreciate his passion for wine.  🍷🍷😊

name: Brooks Wine
address: 21101 SE Cherry Blossom Ln, Amity, OR 97101, USA
reviews: Mike, our wine steward was personable and a great conversationalist! I love his facts about the wine. Thank you to the young couple who gave us their seats so that my 80 year old mother in law could be more comfortable, wonderful cheese plate and great wines...$600 later...

Love Brooks Winery! The view is one in a million the wine and food is fantastic and the staff are so friendly and helpful! A must to visit when driving around the wine country in Yamhill county Oregon.

The worst greeting experience ever.  The greeter said “maybe we can sit you maybe you can get food downstairs. I’m not sure.”  We sat ourselves at the bar and shared that we had never been here and were quite confused by the greeter and this server was no better.  Clearly volume is their goal not experience or quality.  Sent us downstairs and provided no details. We wanders then found downstairs after being pointed the wrong way by the greeter.  Customer service is lost by this organization. The food is amazing and is possibly the only saving grace.  I can’t say enough bad things about the people that work here. Complete disappointment.  

Please don’t waste your time. There’s too many wonderful wineries in the area to experience over the lack of professionalism that the Brooks winery staff has.

Lovely winery and tasting room. We got a red and white flight and everything we tried was good to buy-able. 😉 Their Monks Gates Riesling was excellent. We also got the Plateau de Paco; it was also very good.  They also have lunch selections. Lovely views!
What a wonderful Winery/Vineyard.  Great heated outdoor patio and even better Wine.  Friendly and attentive staff.  Would recommend to any wine aficionado.  I will be returning soon.

name: Silver Falls State Park
address: Silverton, OR 97381, USA
reviews:
Beautiful place. Highly recommend to anyone that enjoys nature and hiking. The location has many different hiking trails from short to long, so it's a great hike for any experience level. There should be a couple of different loops you can choose from, or get to see all of them (there should be 10).

Park also has picnic area, cafe, tour guides for additional activities.

Such an insanely beautiful state park. Possibly my favorite state park in Oregon, Silver Falls State Park is a dream for Waterfall lovers. Over 10 individual waterfalls with two you can actually walk behind. It truly is a magical place. An oregonian must visit destination. Can not stress the beauty of this park enough.

Stayed a few nights in cabin 2. The cabins sleep 5 easily with a table and 4 chairs. Only 2 outlets in the main room so plan accordingly. The bed padding was very comfortable. The curtains keep out a lot of light. The nearby bathrooms and showers are restricted to cabin campers use only. Plus the shower is free! Was able to bike around quite a bit. Hiking options galore. Free lectures twice a day targeted to the young campers. $5 wood bundles. $2 ice bags. $1 firestarter disks. 
There whole place is alive with nature animals and plants. So green! Will definitely be returning asap.
This was the off season, so it wasn't crowded. Beautiful waterfalls! There's a long hike we hope to do some other time, that leads to a number of other waterfalls.

Silver Falls State Park is a must see for anyone visiting the greater Salem Oregon area.  The hiking and picturesque waterfall viewing locations are spectacular!  If you are up to it physically make the full hike to see all of the falls.  As an option, there are excellent parking and picnic grounds with very short walk to the easy viewing areas for the first fall.

name: Champoeg State Park
address: 8239 Champoeg Rd NE, St Paul, OR 97137, USA
reviews: Had a great time! I brought my small dog with me and it was lovely.  He had a blast and so did I.  The yurt was roomy, and had plenty of space for several people.  It was a wee bit cold, but for February,  I expected worse.

Great place for walking on paved trails next to the Willamette River.  Covered picnic areas, sink, bathrooms with running water, showers, camp sites, RV dump site, great place for a bicycle ride. 

The visitor center is awesome, education exhibits, it's a small museum.

$5 day permit per car.
We have had so many awesome family reunions here! It's a very quiet park, surrounded by manicured greenery and well kept picnic tables. Very easy to reserve covered spaces for special events.
Beautiful park with lots of walking trails. Pet friendly. Campground with RV spaces. Oregon State Park day use fees apply. Best for folks who want open space with few other amenities.
Love this place it was a great walk and beautiful forest. I can't wait to see it when the trees have leaves again. I will definetly come back to walk through the trees again.

name: Champoeg State Heritage Area
address: Champoeg State Heritage Area, St Paul, OR 97137, USA
reviews: I haven't been here for years. It's still pretty place.

I love this park! It’s super pretty with all the oak trees. Great disc golf course, great camping sites(can book online) there is lots open areas. If your looking for good reliable park, this is the one.
This is a great bike trail to teach kids how to ride bikes.

The Champoeg State Heritage Area is a must visit for those visiting Oregon and native Oregonians. The picturesque views of the Willamette Valley are worth it alone. Champoeg includes a visitor center with an impressive museum detailing the history of not only the area, but also the Oregon Country's first steps toward government. The gift shop included many books on local history. Both adults and kids will enjoy these, as well as the heritage garden and a historic barn. Hiking / biking trails abound, including one down to a historic store in Butteville with amazing ice cream sandwiches. The camping is also excellent. Showers, and restroom facilities are at or above average. The area is ideally located halfway between Portland and Salem with easy access to Interstate 5.
Wonderful place! Very historic in relation to Oregon becoming a state. Be sure to check out the museum at the Visitors Center.

name: Ankeny National Wildlife Refuge
address: 2301 Wintel Rd S, Jefferson, OR 97352, USA
reviews: I had difficulty finding the trails but did find the impressive boardwalk along the stream which ends at the observation structure. Appreciated the bird lists and maps in both English and Spanish available at the sin posting at the parking lot. The signage along the wooded boardwalk was well done. I’m looking forward to the expected opening of the newly built Ankeny Hill Nature Center with new trails, observation platforms, and parking lots. There are three partners who will be managing the Center. Those partners are the U. S. Fish and Wildlife Service, Salem Audubon Society and Friends of the Willamette Valley National Refuge Complex.  US Highway Dept has reportedly had a delay in the completion of the work for safety reasons and I understand the new date will be next summer.

The one it led us to was literally a 0.2 mile walk. Board walk is well kept up. Idk if we missed a section or what. We went up the road to another "section" of the park but it wasn't pet friendly and we had our pup with us.
Absolutely beautiful place to take a stroll and observe the wildlife. Lots of birds and other natural wonders to behold. Thoroughly enjoy my trips out here.
So much to explore that you dont want to leave. I always find a good spot and campout for a few hours with my uke and guitar just strumming along. The best way to reset and take some time for quiet.

Totally enchanting area. I highly suggest this scenic wildlife reserve to all nature lovers.
The boardwalk takes you over waters that raise and lower with the seasons to gazebos that look out into different landscapes. Bring your binoculars and spot all kinds of birds. 
In the fog early morning, it feels like your walking on clouds in the trees. 
Great for families, the area will have closed signs if waters are too high or anything is unsafe. Bring the kids, bring your leashed dog, and enjoy the natural beauty!

name: Wings & Waves Waterpark
address: 460 NE Captain Michael King Smith Way, McMinnville, OR 97128, USA
reviews: More like Wings & NO Waves.  The Kiddo's play structure was down due to waiting on a part to fix it.  The wave pool was down due to maintenance.  I read the reviews about how the paint is peeling - so I was expecting that when traveling to the facility.   I could complain, but really we still had fun.   My kid's (6 and 14) loved the slides (Green is the favorite).  Even though the wave pool wasn't working it was still a cool experience.  The whirl pool feature was fun too.  All in all - we had fun.... most of all my kid's had the most amazing time and that is worth every penny I spent for the experience.  Yes - we will most likely be back, but will definitely call first to ensure everything is working properly. ;)

Wing and Waves is a great location to take the whole family. My wife and I love that we are able to give our seven year old more freedom with going down slides by himself while we stay with our four year old. We love how open the water park is and easy it is to see all the different areas and pools.

Great place for the whole family.  Lots of parking, large areas to bring your own picnic items.  Descent in store snack bar, prices were fair for the descent portions.  We purchased our admission on Groupon for 4.  However, they offer a substantial active duty military discount and 10% for vets all of the time.  Lines went fast, wife and two of my kids had a great time.  I do wish they had a separate hot tub for adults, some people don't manage their children well, and it is packed with small children at times.  However, it's still a great time, well worth checking out.

We came on President’s Day 2020 for the first time. We brought our 6 year old thinking it would be great fun. We were charged full price even though  all of the attractions designed for her age were closed for repairs. Such a disappointment. They should have offered a discount due to the current status of the facility. I recommend making sure the place is in full operation before you spend your money to get in.

Good but when we visited the wave pool wasn't working and the toddler area was also closed down. The hot tub had so many people in it .. it was overflowing to the pool. The price was pretty hight for half the park being closed. not sure we will be back but not sad we went.

name: Trinity Vineyards
address: 1031 Wahl Ln S, Salem, OR 97306, USA
reviews: Great wines, really nice place for summer music and taking your love for a relaxing time while taking in the spectacular views.
Great wine at reasonable prices.  If you didn't attend one or more of the music concerts, you missed out.  I hope the BBQ folks are back next year!

Visited today and was very sadly unimpressed. My wife and I bought two glasses of wine and were told that the wine we chose from the menu displayed wasn’t available yet. I then asked if I could order a cheese plate to go with the second wine choice only to be told they could not sell me a cheese plate because there was a pizza food truck on the way. It was 4:45. Apparently if your there at 4:45, you have to pay a cover charge for a band that starts at 6. So, 2 glasses of wine and $44 dollars later we did not stay for the band, and I kindly asked since were not staying after we paid could I please take the glasses as a souvenir since we were visiting from Alaska. I was kindly told no, “he” (whoever that is), does not sell the glasses. I have traveled to many wineries. I am not writing this as a bash. As a matter of fact, I rarely write reviews because I believe if good service is presented, that places will soar. I am simply suggesting that I saw Trinity as a bit unorganized and not really in tune to market the wine and want customers to enjoy the experience but rather use it as a glorified backyard bbq with a band. I wish them well and hope this helps their path to better customer service

We love Trinity Vineyards. Conveniently located in the South Salem hills. They are typically offering 2 flights: one white and one red. For certain occasions they'll have a complimentary snack bar laid out in the tasting room. They also host live music once every other month of so. The estate is small, but beautiful. There's a nice balcony outside with a great view. Their 2014 Pinot Noir and 2009 Reserve Pinot Noir were amazing. Steve and Leanna have both treated us very well. I'd highly recommend to anyone in the area!

This is not only a spectacularly beautiful location but a wonderful place to gather with friends, listen to music and drink delicious wine. The owners/hosts will make you feel like family which will make you want to return again and again. Viva la Trinty Vineyards!

name: Courthouse Square Park
address: 402 3rd St, Dayton, OR 97114, USA
reviews: Family friendly and super fun. Dayton Friday nights runs Memorial day - Labor Day. Free music, classic car show, cheap eats, activities and vendors. Every year and just gets better and better. Don't miss the Lantern Parade celebration on the last Friday of Dayton Friday nights which concludes this entire summer weekly.
The park is well-maintained. The Blockhouse is historically significant with informative signs. The structure is in great shape.
A beautiful park for such a small town
Small town America at it's best! A farming community that has a Big Heart for serving young and old. A common sense Mayor at the helm with a strong community support.
I miss the old swings but love the new equipment. People there are so friendly!

name: Bryn Mawr Vineyards
address: 5935 Bethel Heights Rd NW, Salem, OR 97304, USA
reviews: Had a wonderful experience in their beautiful, new tasting room last week!  The service, wine, aesthetic, views were all incredible.  They are going to start offering weddings there - it would be an amazing venue for one!  Ordered wine to ship home and it promptly arrived, but one bottle was different from what I ordered.  I emailed them and within an hour they had replied, shipped me the correct bottle the very next day, and let me keep the extra bottle.  Such great customer service!!!

Visited Bryn Mawr for the first time today and I think I'll have a hard time finding other vineyards that can compare. The view from the tasting room is stunning, the wine is perfect, and everyone we encountered there was so friendly. Hope to be back soon!
Beautiful view, friendly staff and fantastic wine

Had the opportunity to spend some time at the new tasting room at Bryn Mawr. What a stunner! The wines were balanced, the staff was knowledgeable and the views could not be beat! We had a wonderful time and looking forward to getting back soon. Highlights included a fireplace (Feb is a bit cool!), charcuterie board, and long list of unique varietals to taste.

Beautiful location and some amazing wine.  David was fantastic and poured a flight of wines equal to the view from the tasting room. Well worth the drive down from Portland. Looking forward to a trip back when there is some green in the vineyard

name: Spirit Mountain Casino
address: 27100 SW Salmon River Hwy, Grand Ronde, OR 97347, USA
reviews: Always fun. Even though I haven't ever had a "big win", MY biggest personal win was almost $500 off of only $20! I was happy for that. But they've got a wide range of machines, card & table games. Their buffet is GREAT! We've went for our holiday dinner two years now. I haven't attended any events there yet myself but am definitely open to the idea & they have many good events all the time. Any time my family comes to visit from Alaska, Spirit Mountain is one of our stops.

Honestly, in comparison to Chinook winds, it is amazing. Their new smoke-free side is huge and it genuinely does not smell like cigarettes. That was so impressive because Chinook wind is absolutely horrible. Not Only is it of average size and just about average in every other way, it is absolutely awful for the smell of cigarettes. Their non-smoking section as a joke and the smoke just comes right in. I’m not sure why they even called us non-smoking section. Spirit mountain is not like that. They have better games, they have more space, and they have a phenomenal non-smoking section. Everything from food to the machines, to the rooms, is better at Spirit Mountain.

We were there on the 18 of January to see Smokey Robinson. Great concert, well worth it!!! However the " Famous Buffet " was NOT!!!  I have worked many years in service industry where we lived off of tips, if the wait staff and table cleaners from Spirit Mountain live off tips, they will not make it!! They did not smile, were not friendly or welcoming or even helpful really. The food was less than great, bad actually. Prime rib was tough, and pizza was cold, and pot roast was different. It just seems to me that if you work with people and in public you would be nice and at least polite. Other than the food and dining experience my  time there was great. I will eat before I go next time!! 
Spirit Mountain needs to tighten up their employees and hire more friendly people!!!

Michele Horne
Portland

Nice casino, pretty big. Great non smoking area, it even has table games in non smoking. Free soda and coffee on the casino floor. Great buffet and sports bar. Rooms are being remodeled at this time, ours was magnificent! Friendly staff, all and all, it's a great casino to spend a night or weekend at.

Took honey here for his birthday. Pro tip: check their website for deals and special rates. Paid around 60 for a night and free breakfast coupons for their buffet were included. I'm not a gambler so I can't really rate that but their buffet is the stuff dreams are made of! (Insert Homer Simpson drool).
