The wait staff let us go and look at the food first before we paid which was so nice because I'm not a fan of buffets. The food was super good. I wish I had an extra stomach to bring with me just to get everything I wanted to eat in there.I would literally drive back up there just for their beef ribs alone. That's how good it was. We will definitely be back. I was disappointed in the lack of native American items in the gift shop though. When I'm on the reservation I like to spend my money on authentic Native American souvenirs.

name: Elsinore Theatre
address: 170 High St SE, Salem, OR 97301, USA
reviews: The Elsinore theater is a fantastic asset to Salem Oregon. I'm impressed at how well it has evolved over the years into a first-class venue.  it's a great place for comedy shows as well as other smaller gatherings.  it's not really the kind of place that allows for much dancing because it has theater seating.   It is close too many really good restaurants in downtown Salem.   parking is a bit of a challenge as it's on streets and an empty parking lots that are normally used during the daytime like at the bank nearby, but you really have to watch the signs and the time so that you don't get nasty parking tickets.

My family watched "A Christmas Story"  at Elsinore Theater. The venue is beautiful and the performance was amazing. The actors were top notch. The orchestra was great. It was fantastic for the whole family.

Absolutely amazing place for all people of every group. Take your spouse or the whole family. Enjoy a night with a group of friends taking in all the culture and beauty thats litterly coming out of the walls. It's like a fine wine in the sense its only gotten better with age. Add a little love, life, and laughter. You have the recipe for master pieces being created and reproduced. Please take the time to support this local diamond downtown Salem and you won't soon forget it.

One of the most beautiful theatres in existence. A true hold over from days when ornate architecture was more than steel and glass. From the comfortable seating to the three register organ, this magnificent beauty is always a memorable affair.

Beautiful theater. Only complaint was the distraction of letting in latecomers who stood in the aisle having a conversation with the chaperone flashing her light around during the performace.  Show up early and respect others time.

name: The Grand Hotel in Salem
address: 201 Liberty St SE, Salem, OR 97301, USA
reviews: This was the most elegant hotel I have every stayed in.  The staff was so attentive they made sure my every need was met. The meals were grand and the drinks at the bar at the end of a long day was perfect with delicious desserts to satisfy me before bed.  I think the bartender was fantastic and we had great conversation while I was winding down after a long day of training at the convention center attached to the building.

I was more than impressed with the customer service at this hotel. They went above and beyond to answer questions and to make us comfortable. The food is AMAZING, from the included breakfast buffet to the moderately priced cuisine in the attached restaurant. Room service was free and quick. The pool and fitness room were beautiful and clean. The bed was a dream, and the convention center modern and efficient. The surroundings are beautiful with a great park to view scenery and walk along the river. I’ll be back, but next time I’m bringing my family!

Everything very nice , clean and customer service was excellent. I went down to the lobby a few times and Robin was excellent and took good care of me. Plus the kids loved the room. Def will be staying here again .

Room service staff was impeccable and super friendly, maybe the evening front desk girls can take a lesson from Emily - this is how you treat a guest! Horrible front desk staff and not much for sound protection in this hotel you will hear loud exhaust all night with the highway next to us and hope u have normal neighbors because the front desk did nothing about the stomping on the floor above us from 5pm to 1am. Traveling for work event and didn’t get much sleep at all. To boot never experienced certain things I experienced at this hotel and I travel all the time.

***Truly appreciate your response, was trying to speak to you directly however front desk and gen mgr Scott would not provide me with this information. Would love to share with you so it does not happen to another client.
the room that i stayed in was very clean and well taken care of. the workers there were friendly and very helpful. would definitely come back again.

name: Domaine Serene Winery
address: 6555 NE Hilltop Ln, Dayton, OR 97114, USA
reviews: The grounds are beautiful and the wine is very good. Our semmelier (Jim) was fantastic too. This place is upscale so expect to pay a little bit more, but it was worth it. I only wish there was more outdoor seating and the cheese and meat plate was more descriptive.

Wow! Just....Wow. Like a five-star resort in San Diego or Palm Springs. I'd rate it five-stars just for the facility alone. But the view is also five stars as was the wine, food and service. You won't find a better winery than this anywhere.

Honestly, no words. Mine and my families decision to stop at this winery over the weekend was a great one. It was my moms birthday, and we reserved the “Prestige Experience” for our family. There was 8 of us... our hostess, Autumn, was incredibly knowledgeable and very fun to interact with. She had us laughing the entire time, and you can tell she has a passion for her job, which says a lot. The facility is state of the art... I mean it’s unreal. You feel like you’re in a place out of a fancy Hollywood movie. They also have a hotel in burgundy and make wine in France and import the bottles.. so Autumn poured us an extra pour of French wine and it was amazing. Seriously can’t say enough positive things about Domaine Serene. I wish we lived closer, because we’d be back frequently, and would sign up for their membership. Absolutely worth it!
Beautiful tasting and property. Friendly staff and great wine. Very limited food selection during wine tasting, but overall a good experience.

03/17/19:  4.75 out of 5 - Domaine Serene has wonderful Pinot Noirs and other whites and roses.  The estate is expansive with wonderful and spacious features and outside seating with great views.

The staff are very nice, accommodating, and knowledgeable.  But, quite welcoming.  Enjoyed the non-intrusiveness, as well.

Definitely a great winery to try once for all its wonderful wines and to decide for yourself.

Enjoy!

name: Portland Japanese Garden
address: 611 SW Kingston Ave, Portland, OR 97205, USA
reviews: In the middle of the hustle and bustle of Portland is the beautiful refuge of the Japanese Gardens.  Built high above Washington Park, the Gardens are quiet, serene and a step back in time.  Not all is ancient, however. There is a modern cafe where true Japanese food is cooked and served to order.  There is a building dedicated to traveling art exhibits.  It is worth the time to visit the Gardens, walk the wooded paths and believe for a short time that you are on the other side of the Pacific Rim.

It is a blend of incredible trees, bushes, paths, sculptures, water features, and serenity. Here you will find a fresh new tale of wonder being told every day as you journey through winding paths, experience waterfalls and see color explode around you. A not to be missed experience! Took about 2 hours to get through the garden. The tea house was also lovely but would recommend making a reservation or getting on the wait list before you start walking around. The tea house was also lovely but would recommend making a reservation or getting on the wait list before you start walking around.  I think the price is fairly reasonable considering how beautiful the gardens are, and I would definitely recommend for anyone visiting the area! Loved the little water features, the changing leaves, views of the city, and how well kept everything was.

A great place to spend part of your day while in Portland. 
A great mix of statues,  structures, plants,  trees,  water features, and the like.  Lots of serenity strolling around the grounds. Could be a great place to sit with a book and just relax.  The Umami Cafe has a great selection of teas and treats.  Be ready for a small hike to get up into the garden.

Very beautiful and peaceful.  If you can go in the off-season when it isn't crowded I would suggest that.  There is a beautiful rose garden across the way as well.  I was surprised how small the area is.  I wouldn't recommend going in the summer when it's packed.  This is a great place to go to read a book or ponder life when it's not busy.

Beautiful garden! Enjoyed the guided tour and highly recommend you take it as you learn so much more depth of meaning that isn't posted. Also enjoyed the music performance in the education centre while waiting for rain to pass.

name: Jackson Jewelers
address: 225 Liberty St NE, Salem, OR 97301, USA
reviews: Brett helped me design and create a custom ring using diamonds from my grandmother’s engagement ring. He was patient, thorough, and kept in close communication with me throughout the process. The ring is absolutely beautiful and perfect for my lifestyle. Thank you, Brett!

Jackson Jewelers is awesome. I went into the store several times to look at the diamonds to figure out what I wanted. They have an amazing selection.  Their prices are good too.  My original ring was from a brick and mortar store so not the best quality. They helped me design the perfect ring and I just love it!!!  It’s sparkles like crazy and is the perfect ring for me.  It really is.  I worked with Tyler, mostly, and I just love him too. Everyone that works there is amazing and I love that it is a family business that has been in Salem for like 75 years.  😄

I’ve always had amazing experiences working with Jackson jewelers.  They somehow make me feel like part of the family!  Truly an organization of honest experts and I look forward to working with them again.
Always a pleasure doing business with Jacksons.  We’ve been coming here for years, always the best quality product and excellent customer service!

Best jewelry store in Salem and around! Very pleasant and experienced staff, high quality jewelries, great location in town. When you buy something here at Jackson Jewelers, they support you all the way to the end!

name: Keeler Estate Vineyard
address: 5100 SE Rice Ln, Amity, OR 97101, USA
reviews:
A lovely estate and very warm hostess Gabrielle who will help you understand their operation, ecological practices, and enjoy their fabulous wines.
 Dog friendly too!
Wonderful wines of many variatals, a beautiful setting, and warm staff!  A must visit on your wine tasting trip!

My friend and I went there two weeks ago and this was our first winery stop. The tasting room is so comfortable, the grounds are beautiful, the wines are fantastic, but most importantly the customer service was beyond great. Kelly was our tasting room attendant and she was very knowledgeable, friendly, approachable, and made us feel like we were a part of the family. Highly recommend the stop and if Kelly is there ask for her because you will not be disappointed!!

My husband and I had a wonderful experience hosting a picnic for ~ 40 friends at Keeler Estates on the day after our wedding.  Gabrielle, the vineyard owner, worked with us to prepare a wonderful spread of high quality appetizers, and arranged an intimate setting for our group to gather.  The wines are fabulous, and the landscaping is really gorgeous - perfect for an intimate stroll for couples or for families with active kids.  We're planning to come back for another visit soon!
The only thing better than the wine is Mrs. Keeler.  Fantastic wine and good people...the textbook definition of what a proper vineyard experience should be.

name: Arcane Cellars Winery
address: 22350 Magness Rd NW, Salem, OR 97304, USA
reviews: I had a wonderful time at this relaxed family owned winery. Next time out-of-state friends come to visit I will definitely bring them here. The location is right on the Willamette river. You can even take the nearby ferry across the river if you're coming from I-5 (always check first to make sure the ferry is running). Bocce, horseshoes and corn hole lawn games are a great way to pass the time while sharing a bottle with friends. Bring a picnic!
Truly friendly people who make a huge selection of wines. Each of their wines is amazing too! Such a beautiful location, right on the Willamette River.
Joined the wine club.  Look forward to coming back to pick up my wine orders each quarter!
Great little winery, friendly staff, and great tasting wine.  Relaxed setting on the Willamette River.

I discovered an excellent wine in the tasting room, which I just had to buy, and listened to a wonderful bluegrass band outside on a sunny summer day. Worth the trip. Great for weddings, with a tiny house on wheels for such occasions.

name: Salem Radiology Consultants
address: 2925 Ryan Dr SE, Salem, OR 97301, USA
reviews: The staff was professional and knowledgeable. The MRI was thorough and the technician explained everything in detail and kept me informed of each step during the MRI. The technician was patient and was quick and efficient.  The machine had more space than any other MRI machine I have ever been in.  I would highly recommend Salem Radiology Consultants.

If there were 10 Stars, I would give them! Everyone was so kind and accommodating, and they really relieved my anxiousness over a procedure. Ive been an RN for many years and know how important it is to make clients feel comfortable. If ever I need these services again, I will go to Salem Radiology. Thank you so much!

The people here are kind & helpful. I had a surprisingly short wait; I even joked that they didn't give me enough time to look at their magazine. They did a fair job of explaining what was going on ~ and would have answered my questions, if I had thought of any :-) I've gone to them for many years & many procedures. I believe they do a great job.

Great experience from the beginning to the end. Friendly helpful courteous and knowledgeable staff and technicians. 
A special mention needs to go to Travis Fromwiller M.D.
He did a wet read for me and showed me where my wrist was fractured. He really went the extra mile. His compassion, understanding and kindness will not be forgotten.

Friendly and considerate staff from entrance to exit. All of the staff were professional and treated me with respect. No one was at all condescending towards me. This something I appreciate more and more the older I become.

name: Rafns'
address: 479 Court St NE, Salem, OR 97301, USA
reviews:
Absolutely lovely evening.

It's small, quiet, with gentle music.

The server was helpful and charismatic and everything felt extremely special.

The food was exquisite. The portions weren't large, but they weren't small either. A full course left a very satisfying feeling.

A little pricey, but not really that bad at all, and the food and drinks were well worth it.

Would definitely recommend.
Attentive service and excellent food! A delightful dining experience. The salmon dip is divine!

Looking at it from the outside there's nothing to betray what's inside Rafn's. There is nothing extravagant about the niceties of this place. The surprises are printed on the menu and wine list, the servers' description of the night's specials and the suggestion of complimenting combos from the kitchen for your enjoyment. This restaurant is what you hope for when you decide to expend your hard earned money on a great night out or a leisurely afternoon nosh.

This is our favorite restaurant in Salem.
The menu is clean and delicious, and the customer service is unmatched. Always choose the soup because no one does soup like Rafn’s! Thank you for a consistently delicious and pampered experience!
Nice folks!

name: The Sassy Onion Grill
address: 1244 State St, Salem, OR 97301, USA
reviews: Amazing food! Definitely go in and try it. Even when there is a decent line it goes quick. I love what they have done with the place. Looks so nice and modern now! Fantastic staff!

Horrible. At least what I chose to order was not sure how the rest of the menu is. I ordered corned beef hash plate. No flavor. Very blan and watery tasting. They didn’t include silverware in a lunch take out order. Nor did they think to include salt and pepper packets for a breakfast menu item with eggs etc. 
My order was ready fast... just not impressed. I don’t know if I’d be back for the price. $16 for that plate was such a waste and they served me burnt toast. 
:/ So sad to write this review because I love diners and cafe style food. The pictures looked great online. I was so hungry it would have been easy to please me today, so that’s why I had to write this review. Choose some where else to support during these times in my opinion.

The stuffed
 French toast was amazing,  the BTA scramble was creamy and huge.  The fresh homemade toast and sassy jam was worth the trip itself.  Large portions, fresh hot coffee and friendly service in a very clean updated location.

We love Sassy Onion. I have been many times and yet every time I have a hard time deciding what to eat. Everything is so delicious and the portions are huge! Pricing is good. We have always had very friendly staff and great service! Even with people waiting for a table the wait is never very long. They are so efficient! I highly recommend Sassy!

Excellent place for huge portions of diner classics. Tried the chicken fried steak and the beef brisket hash, both of which were fantastic. The thick slice of toasted sourdough and the biscuit were also very tasty, well worth the carb overload. Definitely a solid destination for breakfast or brunch on Salem.

name: Annette's Westgate
address: 1311 Edgewater St NW, Salem, OR 97304, USA
reviews:
So delicious and the serving sizes are so HUGE! More food than we knew what to do with. Thank goodness for to go boxes. The 20 minute wait was totally worth it. DON'T BE TURNED AWAY BY IT. Come a little early and plan for it. Food service was fast and courteous. Coffee refills a little slow but with a packed house, we can all be patient. 
Thank you for amazing meals!

Went to Annette's for the first time this weekend, and were not disappointed! The portions were huge for the price, and customer service was quick. Moving forward remember to bring your own beverage straw, as they are participating in the 'no straw initiative' that the city of Salem is beginning. The food was very fresh and tasted great! We will definitely come back. I hope to try the desserts next time, they looked divine!
I love the salad bar here. It's always fresh and delicious. Today,  I had the pulled pork cheeseburger. It was great. (Get the salad bar as the side)

Always solid food! Favorite is "Build Your Own Mac and Cheese" where you add your preferred meats and veggies to their Mac and Cheese. Friendly and helpful staff. Cook Joseph does a fantastic job! Cozy and down home atmosphere.

So laid back and incredible food. Our server was so sweet (we sat in the bar). The portions were more than generous and even though my food was fried, it wasn't overly greasy. I had the fish and chips with tots and a cup of chowder. The chowder was so flavorful! Adding tobasco to it seemed wrong! I was informed by the server that they change their fry oil twice a day to ensure freshness. 10/10 would recommend.

name: Amadeus Restaurant
address: 135 Liberty St NE, Salem, OR 97301, USA
reviews: I am so embarrassed that I have never tried this restaurant until the other day after knowing of it for over 10 years.  I enjoyed it so much for lunch, I brought my friends back in for dinner.   This is hands down the best  gourmet food in all of Salem and the prices are ridiculously cheap for the quality.  Somebody definitely knows what they are doing.  Service is impeccable as well.   I so so so enjoyed this place.

Came in just as they were opening for dinner, and what a perfect time to dine here. Started off with drinks and the lamb sliders. Great bartender, friendly and amazing service. Had to go with the classic cooked medium rare, tender and to perfection. Topped it off with dessert and a Irish coffee. Will definitely be back.

We've been there twice, once at the bar to dine and another time at a table. Dining at the bar which is small, was very good. We found the menu to be amazing. We found the service and food to be very good. And they were very accommodating as my sister does not like potatoes, so they gave a bit more of the veggie. We'll be back again as our son will be at Willamette on the baseball team for another 3 years!

I've never been disappointed at Amadeus. From the greeting to the appetizers, dinner through dessert. I had their delicious pork chop with gnocchi, apple-bacon compote and broccolini. Then their amazing bread pudding to finish. I'm stuffed and my pants hardly fit. But man, am I glad I went!
Absolutely incredible! The food was out of this world, service was wonderful and the dessert was to die for! Our new go to, couldn’t recommend more!

name: Ritter's Housemade Foods
address: 102 Liberty St NE Suite 100, Salem, OR 97301, USA
reviews: Outstanding! It was my first time here and I absolutely loved it. The ordering process is so quick and easy.. then you sit down, eat, and leave (obviously). I love the atmosphere here. Such a cute restaurant that is well put together. They also have a cute bar area as well that I didn't get to sit at, but next time!
Favorite Friday spot!!  Finally warm enough to eat outside!  The best lemon drops!  Very lively and “hip” place. Fun atmosphere.

My first visit here, with a friend. We decided to split two entrees. A ham and cheese omelette with red potatoes and French toast. I had decaf coffee, she had an espresso. The inlets and red potatoes won my vote, tasty and very good. The French today was good, but a little dry if you didn't use syrup, and i didn't want to that as it came with fruit and cream already. Good service and no ridge to move you on quickly.

First time at Ritter's for a late lunch. After a Oregonzola Burger, cooked as ordered, medium rare and a Italian Sausage, Peppers & Goat Cheese pizza we were all smiles. 2 great lunches for less than I expected, $28. As visitors from the coast that enjoy our day trips to Salem we'll be back. Great service as well. I should also mention the bar looked well stocked and inviting. For the younger set a stool at the bar looked like fun.

The food was very good especially for the prices. Everything tasted fresh and like it was made with quality ingredients. I didn't have a drink but since they need a ladder to reach all the different alcohol I'm sure their selection is extensive. The happy hour deals were really good, I'll definitely be back.

name: Happy Bibimbap House
address: 635 Chemeketa St NE, Salem, OR 97301, USA
reviews: Food just like I enjoyed in Korea years ago - fresh, flavorful, and hot.  I highly recommend this restaurant to experience a different, flavorful and wonderful cuisine from an under recognized culinary culture! They have an excellent sampling of Japanese favorites, including good sushi, too. I always look for local Asians and foreign students in Asian restaurants because they know authentic, and this is one of those! Staff are excellent, too; friendly, considerate, and truly want you to experience their best.
We love this place. Their spicy pork is excellent and the sides are always fresh and made on-site. Also try their kimchi pancake. Sounds weird but it is really good.

I ordered takeout from here today. I got the noodles with chicken. it was really good and I was so impressed with the size of the portions. They also threw in some scallion pancake appetizer and kimchi. It was a huge lunch at a very reasonable cost. I'll definitely be back!

Each dish has been made with clean, fresh ingredients. My favorite restaurant down town. The staff is more than helpful. Dining area always clean. So much food to eat. Menu has so many selections, I guarantee you will find something you'll love. Sushi is top notch. ❤🍣

Good service and decent food. It definitely hit the spot and I would recommend it. I would like to see the kimchi with a little bit more flavor. I am sure it is not the easiest thing to get in Salem, Or. though.

name: DaVinci Ristorante
address: 180 High St SE, Salem, OR 97301, USA
reviews: Very fancy/ expensive Italian. Friendly, helpful staff. Beautiful and tasty food and drinks. Great atmosphere with piano player.

Food was good but small portions for the prices. I would lower prices or increase portion sizes. Service was also not attentive and tries to rush you out instead of making you feel welcomed. I would coach staff on hospitality and welcoming the customer. Also the Martini I ordered taste like vodka without any vermouth. I would make sure all bartenders are not over pouring or know how to correctly make the top 10. Decent place and atmosphere but room for improvement.

Not sure if I've ever given 5 stars to a restaurant, my memory is flaky in my old age phase....but I will absolutely remember DaVinci. It is saturated with elegance & class in decor, service, food & drink. Lots of thick wood & mirror wall hangings, arches, curtains, antique metal ceiling tile, pleasantly soft lighting, PIANO. The chow was impeccably presented and exquisitely good. If you want to have a special date night, this a VERY good spot to start.

Beautiful restaurant that we were thrilled to discover unexpectedly! The wine was delicious. The entrees were fantastic. The dessert was incredible. And the service was WONDERFUL! Huge recommendations from our family!

I recently celebrated a milestone birthday.  Sixty.  Six-Oh.  You, dear reader, must imagine that a day this special comes once in a lifetime (well, duh!) and that you yourself would probably lean towards a very festive and special way in which to acknowledge the occasion.

name: Rudy's Steakhouse
address: 350 Chemeketa St NE, Salem, OR 97301, USA
reviews: This is my kind of real 5 star dining experience yummy! White table cloth and napkin settings with a salad fork and top rated fine dinner service! The price was NOT outrageous very worth the quality and under the normal expected cost for this fine of a place. I would recommend this for an impressive first date with prime rib and a glass of wine bread salad and dessert for 2 it’s a hundred dollar bill and a damn great night out and amazing food

Had date night and we picked Rudy’s to eat at. Honestly, couldn’t have picked a better restaurant for the evening. Made the reservation on Google and the we got there about 15 minutes early and he actually told me that they were putting our table together then. Very courteous host/hostess staff and just all around great staff and phenomenal service. From the junior weight staff making sure our drinks were kept full and and bread on the table to our waitress. She did a great job for sure. 

Would definitely recommend to anyone. The dining room is very big.

Thank you and good night....
First time dining here. Excellent date night dinner! Great service provided by Charles. Fast meal service too. Will definitely try again
Lovely atmosphere. Wait staff was friendly. Dishes were served quickly, and we're very tasty. Very extensive wine list at this location.
Great business. Very responsible management.  They do the absolute maximum to make sure you get the best dining experience even during the covid era.

name: Wild Pear
address: 372 State St, Salem, OR 97301, USA
reviews: When my daughters and I want to go to lunch, this is our special place! We love their coconut butternut squash soup as a starter, which is always wonderful. Their pear salad is always a must and we usually get one of their pizzas to share. We are also a fan of their Blackberry Italian sodas. Their dessert case has wonderful cupcakes and their cookies are deliciously well.. we love the ambience of the old brick walls and the chandeliers. I have celebrated many birthdays here with my girlfriends! Love this special place!

Hidden gem amongst many choices in downtown Salem. Good location with great food choices. Food is definitely well sourced. Service was really good; Heather was attentive and kind! Had the BLTA, good comfort food with great flavors. Definitely recommend checking it out.

The atmosphere here is perfect. The mix of old school charm and themed decorations make it a comfortable and warm place to eat. The place is busy and well liked so we had to check it out. Food was fantastic. The khalua pork sandwich on a gluten free bun was delicious. Salads and soup were great. Everything tasted homemade and comforting.

Midday you're usually going to run into a wait (especially during the noon hour), so plan ahead. Their food has been delicious every time, regardless of what I've ordered. The service is usually pretty good--some days/servers are better than others, but overall pretty good. The space can get a little loud and a little crowded (some of the tables are very close together), so keep that atmosphere in mind when you're planning. Overall, it's one of my favorite lunch spots in Salem when I'm meeting up with my girlfriends.

This was my first time at the Wild Pear and I was impressed. They were full to capacity unless we wanted to sit at the bar, which we did. The very nice lady that waited on us was attentive even though the bar was full as well. I had the Deluxe BLT and it was delicious. It came with lightly salted chips but we ordered Truffle Sweet Potato fries as well. Everything was as warm or cold as it should have been. I would highly recommend this restaurant to all of my friends and family.

name: Word Of Mouth Neighborhood Bistro
address: 140 17th St NE, Salem, OR 97301, USA
reviews: I am a huge fan of breakfasts and I’ve tried everywhere all over the world but this is truly THE BEST BREAKFASTS IVE EVER HAD MY ENTIRE LIFE. Not only it’s right in my neighborhood it’s cozy and adorable, AMAZING SERVICE! Gabi is the best, she always offer quality service. Even tho she’s not our server she always check up on us, deliver what we needs with a smile. I come here for comfort and it’s truly the best. Thank you to the owners for providing such a wonderful comfort place for the community and for my tummy!

The food is AMAZING. It is worth the weight. They even text you when your table is ready so you can go hang out in town. The staff is friendly, quick, and on their toes at all times. The cinnamon role pancakes were AMAZING and that meal literally lasted 3 meals and 2 snacks. We got a little "random acts of yumness" french toast thing for being patient. Oh my god its the best french toast of my life. Go here. And be nice to the staff!!!!

Very good food and very friendly staff! The biscuits and gravy are done all from scratch and probably the best I’ve ever had! Definitely worth a visit. Well known for their food they do fill up fast. We got there at 7 AM and had to sit at the bar which was totally fine but just know they are busy.

Their bacon is to die for. Thick and cooked to liking. The cinnamon pancakes with cream cheese style icing...huge and delicious. Any change to an order is no problem. We love to do take out too. Sometimes the wait can be 2 hours, but they take your phone number and text you your wait position...so you always know. Great place. Great food. The cinnamon roll pan cake was to die for! There is about an hour wait, but you can give them your phone number and they will text you about 20 minutes before your table is ready. That was delicious also!!!

Website says open today, but they're NOT!!! I've been checking everyday & it said temp closed on the website. Today it says open until 3pm,  so I got excited. I went there and they are closed. I tried calling before going and the phone just rang. I figured they were busy, so that's why I went there. Only been there 1 time before and I loved the French toast. I had my ❤ set on French toast... So went to Sassy Onion. 😂 Word of Mouth fix your website!!! 😠

name: Robert's Crossing Restaurant
address: 3635 River Rd S, Salem, OR 97302, USA
reviews: I've been here a few times and it has always been a pleasant experience! A majority of their entrees are very flavorful and well cooked.Their smokey mac and cheese is amazing. The smokiness is not too overwhelming! Love to come here for dinner since not only is the food good but the service is friendly.

I went Robert's Crossing for the first time today. They were great. Beautiful place. Can't wait to try out the patio seating when they reopen.  Food was very delicious!😊 They really go the extra mile to make your experience better. Support local. Great people! Thank you!

Parents' 50th Anniversary was a very special night thanks to all the great folks at Robert's Crossing! In a beautifully lit private room, they made our family celebration festive and unforgettable. The food - divine!
Very tasty foods!  Nice and calm setting!  My partner love his meatloaf dish and clam chowder.   Exceptionally delish!  Excellent service!

Haven't eaten there yet, but planning a function there. The coordinator has been extremely helpful,  and the menu looks great.  This place is not cheap, which was our only reservation. But, if the food lives up to our experience so far, it's going to be well worth it.

name: Marco Polo Global Restaurant
address: 300 Liberty St SE, Salem, OR 97301, USA
reviews: I had a chicken dish (can't recall what exactly) and it was so tender and juicy. It was some of the most heavenly food I've ever had. I went with my family, and their food was delicious too (we all had to try each other's). My mom is on a diet and can't have gluten. They had a special gluten free menu as soon as we came in and at the end when they brought us the fortune cookies, they brought her a gluten free cookie. Best service ever. Loved it and would go again when I have the money. Its not a cheap place but for good reason.

My favorite Asian restaurant. They have all the Asain styles on each page on menu. I’m gluten free and I love how the put on round plates and gluten on square... nice! 
Good prices and great food. Nice location, nice scenery. 6 blocks from waterfront carousel.

This restaurant would even make Chef Ramsey happy! I got the Chicken Saltimbocca and it was absolutely awesome! The staff was delightful and the place was clean and beautiful, despite the busy day they had experienced!

This is a rather sprawling restaurant in downtown Salem with an extensive menu of Italian and Asian dishes. We were impressed with the food, as our expectations were exceeded for this family style restaurant. We visited on a week night, so they were not super busy. Service was very good. I had the seafood fettuccine that was wonderful; the seafood was cooked perfectly and was excellent considering that Salem is not on the coast. My partner had the stir fried asparagus, onions, carrots & garlic with shrimp that was cooked to perfection over brown rice that was cooked perfectly. The wine by the glass was reasonably priced and very good. We highly recommend this restaurant.

Without a doubt the worst dining experience my wife and I have had in Salem. We went out for a lunch experience on this first day of daylight savings time and decided to try something new. We were seated and only offered dinner menus. I asked  about that and the response was they only do lunch menus on weekdays. I ordered Cashew Chicken and my wife went with a Burger. The Cashew Chicken was the most tasteless food I have had in a restaurant. I mean it, no flavor, no sauce, just veggies, chicken and a pan of rice. The ingredients looked fresh but it was as if they had been steamed with no seasoning or sauce. I was able to eat almost none of it. Fortunately my wife's Burger was a bit better but only marginally. I left my whole meal on the table and  my wife left most of hers.

The service was poor as well. In fairness I believe she got I was disappointed and just avoided us. We had been wanting to try this place for a while but now we will not be back.

name: Best Little Roadhouse
address: 1145 Commercial St SE, Salem, OR 97302, USA
reviews: We love this place!  Food is consistently delicious. Servers are usually pleasant, generally a bit of a wait for seating and food. Wish it wasn't so loud though.

This was our choice for eating!  What a busy little place.  Parking is a pain especially for those who just can't seem to park in the lines or take the time to fix the parking job!  The Nuclear margarita was very good and better than the regular one.  We had the creole burger and the chicken sandwich.  They were both really good and everything was hot.  The service was great.  Laura was a sweetheart and so helpful with all of our questions.  The rolls were very good and a great little snack.  After dinner we went out to enjoy a round of mini golf.  It was a nice end to a great day.

This restaurant lived up to it's expectations and reviews. Our group order three different cuts of meat, all cooked perfectly (medium rare, as it should) and seasoned well. The only complaint would be the beef being under salted. The specialty drinks were a play on old fashioned favorites, like the "Tennessee Tea" (essentially a long island ice tea). The prices are very reasonable given the salad, rolls, and side dish you get with an entree. Well worth it!

We have gone there twice now after my daughters cheer leading competitions, and both times service was great! This last time our girls won championships, and our waitress got the staff to clap for them, congratulate them, AND even give them ice cream! They accommodated all 16 of us parents and children! If you ever have a large party I highly recommend coming here for some good food and drinks!

This was one of the best country food dinner places I’ve been to! Nice atmosphere and delicious food and the desserts were huge and to die for! Burgers, steaks, Mac n cheese, salads, etc. My cousins friend had a birthday and the server shouted and got the whole restaurant to sing happy birthday! We’ll never forget that moment!

name: ACME Cafe
address: 110 Hansen Ave S, Salem, OR 97302, USA
reviews: One word comes to mind regarding our dining experience at the Acme Cafe: “OUTSTANDING.”  My wife and I ate an early dinner there for the first time.  I tried their fish and chips and was pleased that I did.  Our food was fresh, served hot, and absolutely delicious.  Our server was very friendly and attentive.  The food portions were generous and commiserate with the price paid for our meals.  We would highly recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for quality comfort food.

Delicious as usual! My wife and I have been coming to this establishment for years and love the great food, service and atmosphere. We've always been treated well and is always clean with excellent and friendly staff.

The food(tomato pie)was delicious...and our waitress(I never caught her name - small, slight build, med brown? hair...😟)was sweet, delightful & helpful. My friend & I were there Tues, 2/25, noon - 1:30. Loved that when we were leaving, the 2 gentlemen behind the glass counter area called out to us, "Thank you for coming in, ladies! Have a wonderful day!" Yes! We will be going back! :)
Quaint place. Service is good. Food is very good. We had breakfast; scramble, and eggs and bacon. The mimosas were delicious!
Amazing food! Really enjoyed it. Great staff and cool environment.

name: The Original Pancake House
address: 4685 Portland Rd NE, Salem, OR 97305, USA
reviews: Exceptionally good breakfast and excellent service.  This is a Salem institution, and for good reason.  Consistently great food and consistently excellent service.  I honestly don't think I've ever had a bad meal here, and I've been many many times. I had the mushroom Omelette and it was outstanding.  It came with buttermilk pancakes and I had them topped with seasonal fresh strawberries. YUM!

Gluten free pancakes galore! Nice and fluffy ones, too!!
I love their Irish inlet. The potatoes are yummy and everything is made fresh, and in house!
We frequently go here and have never been disappointed.... no matter what location it is!!

I can only think of nice things to say about Te Original Pancake House. This restaurant has a coziness that you would expect from a rural breakfast place. The food is outstanding and the service is quick and friendly.

Had the pumpkin pancakes with an Irish omelette! The staff was very accommodating and let us make substitutions for our meals. I even got homemade whipped cream for my coffee and pancakes! This was our second time here as a large group (15+ people) definitely worth the wait!

We have visited the last 3 weeks at the south location on Commercial. I have sampled French crepes, blueberry waffle and last week - Swedish pancakes. The latter was a first time experience and it was terrific. Three large, thin pancakes with a lingonberry covering. It was a very special treat. The staff is very helpful and friendly and eating there is a pleasure. The setting is great with a fire in the fireplace. It does get crowded later on Sunday morning.

name: Gamberetti's
address: 325 High St SE, Salem, OR 97301, USA
reviews: This place used to be really good. But recently due to owner changes and lowered quality product and food the experience has become decidedly sub par. Canned sauces, clearly store bought pastas and raised prices ensure I will not be returning after several attempts to recapture the original enjoyment of this restaurant.

Gambarettis has brought a high-end Italian restaurant to downtown Albany. The price is what you would expect for delicious and complex Italian food. 

With a mix of cocktails that have modern flair, a good selection of wine, great pasta, I would recommend that you try this restaurant.

I had the Brie cheese and mushroom Mac and it was a savory explosion of flavor. I also got to try their Soprano Mac which is always tasty as it has a little heat to each bite and is paired excellently with the sun-dried tomatoes. I've never had the Mosquito IPA before either and I was a huge fan, thanks for the amazing evening!

These folks make the Italian in me very very happy. From the Antipasti to the Bolognese, the crusty whole grain bread and the Willamette Valley olive oil, these folks are the best Italian food in the region. The service is excellent, I've never once felt as if I was lacking in anything. One more thing. I'm a non drinker, and the Shirley Temple is bomb! Thanks folks, I look forward to my next trip.

Gamberetti's Dining Experience: Very warm and relaxed. Real nice vibe! Tina served us and did a spot-on job. The fare: Inventive, fresh, and delicious. 

Each phase of the meal was delivered right on time with an "attention to detail" presentation. Tonight, was Caesar's salad, calamari, and their marinara teamed with three savory-filled meatballs. 

Both a most excellent date night and entire family and friend affair. 

Thank you and much love! 5 Stars! 

Ottimo cibo, from this Sicilian family! :-)

name: The Kitchen on Court Street
address: 466 Court St NE, Salem, OR 97301, USA
reviews: A restaurant with a large diner-style menu updated with great surprises. It also has a shop to grab sandwiches, soups and pastries to go. A great point for me is being open 24/7 (in downtown Salem!). Full bar is available as well. I have tried a few different options and they were fairly good to good. My recent favorite is their fried green tomatoes (by the time I took the picture, half were already gone!) Service is always prompt and courteous but is a small place so you may have to wait depending on the time.

Another foodie must!! Gotta say my favorite are the Pancake tacos!!! If you are like what?! Go try them! They have a pastry/coffee side if you must wait to be seated. Seating is usually 20mins but worth the wait!!

If I had any constructive criticism to offer it would be the space.  They ate crammed into such a narrow space I literally felt like the strangers to my right and left were family... and I'm an introvert so my personal space is very important to me so that does stand out as something that would impact my decision to go back there.   Besides that, the food, service and price were all perfect.  I couldn't criticize a single other thing.

The Kitchen on Court Street is the best 24hour restaurant in Salem. They serve their whole menu all day and night. They have a fairly diverse menu with their slightly bougie take on classic diner foods. They are a little pricey but they use fresh local ingredients. You are definitely getting what you pay for!

Thanks for the great meal and excellent service. 
I was very impressed with my meal! If anyone is looking for good Benedict for breakfast, I'd recommend this place! 
Thank you so much for the meal, as a furloughed employee I really appreciate the warm warm meal before a job interview.

name: Bentley's
address: 291 Liberty St SE, Salem, OR 97301, USA
reviews:
Food description was off. I ordered seafood risotto and it was basically chewy seafood in a tomato sauce with white rice on top. Poorly seasoned. Appetizers included a grilled slice of cheese with peppers, and creamy texture crab cakes. 

I had high hopes for this place, but it didn’t turn out great. The food were things I could easily make (better) at home. They comped our meal though, as we didn’t want to eat it. 

The drinks were great though. 

There are a lot of great reviews, so maybe it was just an off night?

I recently had lunch at Bentley's for the first time. The service and ambiance were great, and the food was fresh, well-prepared and attractive. As a long-time vegan, however, I would have been happier to see more vegan options (including ample protein) on the menu. It was also too pricey for me to eat there very often.

Bentley's is attached to the Grand Hotel and as such, has a beautiful interior. Slight disappointment at first as we entered in off the street rather than through the hotel and therefore it took a while to be noticed (had we walked around to the other entrance, we would have been seated quicker). After that small snafu, we were given a table and served very quickly. We got our food so fast after ordering and it was very hot! The meal was delicious and our server was nice, fun, and lovely. Overall, it was a great dinner experience.

Very attentive service, that when truly watched shines.
There are clearly Silver Service and Sommelier trained staff about the place and that really impressed me, I didn't expect it.
The food was excellent, my party had all sorts of requests, each taken in their stride by the staff. I enjoyed the drinks too. I ordered a Russian Mule and it came in a metal vessel, whilst not copper, it was a nod that someone knew, and gave a damn.
Bentley's has never disappointed me! Tonight was a little weird, as they were filming something, so the vibe was different. But the food was great and we had wonderful service from Jeremiah!

name: Sisters Irish Bistro
address: 189 Liberty St NE, Salem, OR 97301, USA
reviews:
This is specifically a food review as I ordered the shepherd's pie off of grubhub today while I was at home sick. Nothing hits home like a hearty warm meal when you're sick on a col rainy day so this dish sounded perfect!
The portion size was great for the price. A little too much cheese on top for me but that's no big deal. However, the amount of mashed potatoes and peas was INSANE. There were so many peas in the pie that I could barely taste the lamb and seasoning. Had to push the mashed potatoes to the side, must have been at least 3 full cups on top! I still ate it but not something I would pay that much for again.

Review subject to change once I go in person for a visit! :)

Today, I had the pleasure of experiencing a heaping slice of Ireland tucked inside a historic masterpiece and topped with the kind of perfectly executed classic Irish kitchen cooking that transports the diner seven thousand miles in the time it takes to consume one home cooked meal. Sister Irish Bistro, a true labor of love for the multi-generation family that runs it, offers excellent service, freshly prepared classic Irish cuisine done right, and an atmosphere that is nothing short of perfect. Located in the below ground level of the historic Reed Opera House in downtown Salem, it is more than worth the trip whether you're entertaining large groups or just want a quiet drink (anyone looking for a place to get a perfectly poured Guinness, look no further). In one night, Sisters Bistro became one of my favorite places to simply be. You won't be disappointed.

Listen . If you want genuine and exceptional irish fare, get down there. Perfect atmosphere. Tonight there was a musician playing guitar, flute and harp. Great service. We ordered 6 different plates among our group and everything was delicious. Couldn't keep my fork on my own plate. 🤷‍♀️

Hidden Gem in Salem. We were driving through and found this spot! (Hint..its downstairs at the old opera house). Great food, great beers and great staff. Many of the recipes are from the owners family....delicious!! Highly recommended and we will definitely go again !
My wife and I ordered this through ubereats. We got the shepherd pie and sausage rolls. Extremely good quality food absolutely delicious and even pleasing to a one year old.

name: Patty's Off-Center Cafe
address: 1741 Center St NE, Salem, OR 97301, USA
reviews: Cozy little restaurant. The staff are nice and welcoming. The decor is chicken themed which is pretty fun. The food is good and it came out fairly quickly. Been here a couple of times now and will continue to come here!

Cute smallish breakfast/lunch cafe. Excellent service, good coffee never ran empty. Veggie options but great bacon too. Benedict choices and daily specials that looked good. We had the standard eggs, meat and yummy country potatoes (w/onions and red peppers). Others had the blueberry pancakes said they were excellent with lots of berries. Though we didn't try them the herb biscuits are truly a treat. Fairly priced with lots of parking, easy to find. One of those places you could make a habit for breakfast.

It was fantastic, as usual! I always gravitate towards the Eggs Benedict, because it's the best version I've ever had. He also ads fresh spinach to mine (I prefer). Then, I get a side of gravy to put on the potatoes. Pure Heaven. I don't even order eggs benedict anywhere else anymore. 
Best Clam Chowder (w/toast points) in town as well (Fri/Sat)...says my Daughter. 
Cheers! 🏆

We are first time visitors from out of town. Patty’s Off-Center Cafe (literally off of Center St) may not look like much from the outside but as soon as I walked in the door, it felt like I was at home in Mom’s kitchen ready for some good, home-style cooking - and that’s exactly what it was! The food was delicious and the presentation of the plates by far exceeded my expectations. You can tell that they truly take pride in their cooking! Not only did the food taste good but the pricing was definitely reasonable. The staff was super friendly and always made sure we were taken care of, the chef even went the extra mile to give us some bacon for our pupps outside! I highly recommend this restaurant!

The quality and flavor of food here was amazing.   There is no better food in Salem and the owners are terrific hosts in this quaint and comfortable setting.   This is my fourth visit and every time I'm more impressed.   The daily specials are very well named - German Hash and the Club Sandwich!

name: The RAM
address: 515 12th St SE, Salem, OR 97301, USA
reviews:
Service was very accommodating and food was mediocre. The club sandwich was a little large and dry (not enough mayo) but they corrected so. This place has some of the best home made potato chips I’ve ever had. I highly recommend it. 

They also brought out a pitcher of root beer rather than small glasses and charged the same as the small glass which was very nice.

I've been eating here for years, even cooked at the RAM for a bit in my youth. What a great place for a summer lunch! Shaded or sunny seating can usually be had out on the deck over the creek. The food is great, service is usually good and the drinks are above average. This trip was nice because it was on a Monday, happy hour prices all day! This meant a nine dollar burger was 4 and change, two more bucks to make it a meal. The ram is a nice place to eat, and you will usually spend more than at a quick lunch spot, but you can make it economical by choosing wisely. I would have taken a Star off for the two day old topper on my Bloody Mary (which was otherwise good) but the waiter kindly comped it after seeing it. It was a rare miss and they fixed it.

Awesome place to grab a bite and watch the game. The steak was cooked perfectly and the appetizers were just as great. Friendly service! Dorothy, our waitress, provided one of the best dining experiences I have had. Very approach able and communicated well. Will definitely be coming back again

Great place to meet with your parents for an afternoon beer, or two! Friendly staff, great food, amazing brewers making some impressive beers back there. Outdoor patio with a lovely creek view. See you all there!

The service at the bar top is always great.  And while there have a few times where the food is really good, generally they can't get the proteins to the right temp.  A general overhaul of the restaurant would be a good thing.  UPDATE the place for goodness sake.  Chipped plates, bent silverware, dirty rugs, a full deep clean would be a great idea!

name: Bo & Vine Burger Bar
address: 176 Liberty St NE, Salem, OR 97301, USA
reviews: Trendy Burger joint meets local diner prices! The burger was excellent, with tasty toppings and a juicy patty. The sides are an amazing addition. The mixed fries basket that we got was the "sharing" size, and it was more than enough for 4-6 people, let alone 2 of us. It's a great value as well, for 5 dollars gets you all those fries in the picture! On top of that, the dipping sauces are interesting, delicious, and varied. I couldn't recommend this enough to even a casual burger fan. Excited for our next visit!

Man, Saturday night and an empty stomach, I was ready to chow down on some amazing burgers. I've been to the other Bo & Vine locations so I had a pretty good idea of the burger I love. This location has very limited seating which I understand, they have made the best out of the space they have but when people are standing around waiting to take your spot it's a little much. But the food made me feel pretty sick. The burgers were so covered in grease that the first time picking it up, streams ran down our hands. Not the good stream where its buttered and delicious. But like the food was slapped on right out of the greaser. Both my hubby and I couldnt finish either plate. The fries came to the rescue in the end. But I think we'll try some other burger places instead
Got some fries for social hour. They were good as usual, and way too much for my wife and I to finish in one sitting. Their sauce selections are great. Staff is friendly and helpful.

Straight forward menu with just enough selection to satisfy everyone without feeling cluttered. Absolutely loved the fries and burger so I'm looking forward to their HUGE tater tots and unique Chicken Sandwiches next time. Just can't stop thinking about that maple bourbon reduction so if anyone who works there can hook me up with a jar of that I'll let you eat some with me.

Wow this place was amazing! I've been hearing about this place for months and I finally tried it. The burger was yummy once I got past the unusual spices and the fries were some of the best I've ever had. Crispy and a little oily (perfect!) Oh, and their Fry Sauce tastes like Arctic Circle's!!!!

Everything about that place seems top shelf, from Jones Soda in the soda fountain, to the high quality salt to the very sturdy chairs (important to me as a man of size). 

The atmosphere was very relaxed. Music in the background loud enough to hear it, but not loud enough to hear the words, lots of dark woods, I felt totally comfortable sitting alone.

Oh, and the prices! Burger, fries, and a drink for $10.50 at lunch!

name: table FIVE 08
address: 508 State St, Salem, OR 97301, USA
reviews: I brought my daughter in for dinner. Neither of us were impressed. 🙄 The pickled beets on the burger we're not pickled beets, they were bland, canned and a flavorless disappointment. The Rosemary fries were good unfortunately all of our fries came to the table cold. The pickled eggs were close to being okay but for the price, ridiculous! The lemon curd cheesecake was very good and the best thing it we had. My daughter did enjoy the macaroni and cheese. All in all we probably won't be back since our server had better things to do then take our order. The majority of our food was Small and Unsatisfactory. I tried to order a couple more things on the menu. We like to try a variety when we go out. I had not let on to the waiter I was unhappy. When he finally came to the table he gave us a "humph" attitude, I said I'm ready for the check. Not a place I would recommend to my friends and family when they come to visit. ☹️

I have been here several times.  Always have enjoyed the atmosphere.  Food is very good.  Drinks are prepared by an exceptional artist with more personality than a full season of Seinfeld episodes.   Great exposure and location in Downtown Salem.   Close the Theaters!  (Yes plural).  Great asset to Salem.  Our hostess was cheerful, happy and nice!  Thank you.

Our hotel recommended Table Five 08 for dinner and we weren't disappointed. It is a nice downtown setting with a bar area and dining area. The service was very good--friendly, helpful, and attentive. The drink list included several interesting looking cocktails, some regional beers and an extensive wine list, mostly by the bottle but several by the glass. Interestingly, if you don't finish a bottle they will re-cork it with argon to keep it fresh to take home. The food menu had interesting choices and variety. The food we ordered arrived promptly, with a nice presentation and tasted good. Our server helped with wine recommendations to pair with our meals and the pairing worked well. The noise level was quite loud. There was fairly loud background music which encouraged louder conversation from all the diners and which made comfortable conversation nearly impossible. If it wasn't for the noise level this would be a spot I'd be eager to return to.

The table 508 burger is amazing! You may be tempted to ask them to hold the picked beets...but DONT it all works together amazingly! The horseradish sauce is to die for! A definite must if your in the mood for a artisan burger!
Nice atmosphere. Good for lunch or dinner. Very friendly and attentive staff. Food is reliably tasty

name: La Margarita Express
address: 515 Chemeketa St NE, Salem, OR 97301, USA
reviews: The food was amazing, but the service was only okay. It took a long time for someone to take our order, we ended up spending over an hour and a half for lunch because it took so long to get food ordered and arrived. Would recommend, but would plan for more time.

Spicy and delicious! Highly recommend considering good, traditional Mexican/Salvadoran eating is hard to find. They were super quick in the middle of lunch. Staff was very attentive, you won't go wrong here.

Good food, good service. I always get the pupusas and they are always good. They bring beans and salsa out with the chips which is nice when we have the little one with us because he doesn't get impatient. One bummer is they don't have Mexican coke or Pepsi.

I absolutely LOVE this place and the Arroz Con Pollo w/cream sauce is life changing. No seriously, every person that I have ever taken to lunch here has tried mine and are now addicted like I am. The restaurant is clean, the service is good, and the food is fantastic!
I had a chicken dish and the chicken was shredded and had so MUCH flavor. The place is really big inside with different areas decorated so colorfully. Will be back.

name: Christo's Pizzeria & Lounge
address: 1108 Broadway St NE, Salem, OR 97301, USA
reviews:
We had a large group and were informed of the 20% mandatory gratuity ahead of time. I don't necessarily have a problem with that, even though the industry standard is 18% but it's not a big deal. We had the worst service I've ever experienced there. Yet we were forced to tip 20% 
I'm not in the habit of "punishing" staff for poor performance. I just felt like the waitress knew she was going to get a great tip no matter what, so why even try. 
I wouldn't consider this place for a group dinner again.

The food was fine.

Went to this place when I was in Salem for the day. Had a great experience! The quality is top notch and I felt like I was in a actual restaurant in Italy. The pizza crust was the perfect blend of soft with a small bit of crunch. I was also very impressed with the prices for the quality of food that I had. Highly recommend!

Finally made it to Christos after hearing much about how great the jazz is. The marvelous Nancy Hamilton performed there last night and wow wow wow, she is well worth driving an hour to hear! Because the reviews of been spotty, we weren’t sure what to expect about the food but it was great! Wonderful garlicky calzone, Italian varietals by the glass, delicious Caesar salad, we will definitely be back just for the food! we will always come whenever Nancy is playing, I’m glad to not have to drive all the way to Portland or Seattle to hear her!
Good pizza, great staff! It was a bit of a wait to get a table, but the tasty food was well worth it!

First off I want to say the atmosphere was great. For those who like traditional Italian food I would say try the shrimp and risotto it was divine. Now where the restaurant falls short. First I’ve never been to a good Italian restaurant that didn’t serve good Italian or French bread with dinner. I asked for bread and was served slices of some horrible sandwich bread. The ravioli was sad tasted like it came frozen from Walmart. As a suggestion to the owners ;  serve your customers elegant Italian food with good bread and sauce and butter and people will come. Including little extras shows class and believe me what you want is not higher prices but more satisfied customers that will keep coming back again and again.

name: Roger That BBQ
address: 1492 Brush College Rd NW, Salem, OR 97304, USA
reviews: Baked beans are awesome. The brisket tacos are delish. Wings are amazing. For a part time place it rocks.

Tried this place for the 1st time. They sold out of ribs so I had to get the Brisket plate. It was $16 for only 3 slices. The meat had a good looking bark, smoke ring, and the meat was moist without any of the greasyness. Despite the appearance, the Brisket was just OK. The meat didn't seem to have any flavor. I had to use quite a bit of BBQ sauce to make it better. The Hot Link also wasn't that great. It did have a kick though. All in all, the food wasn't really memorable or anything special. I will still go back to try the ribs even though I prefer Spare Ribs over Baby Backs and give the Brisket another shot. You might enjoy this place if you're a casual enjoyer of BBQ and have the craving for decent BBQ.

Wonderful for and atmosphere! BEST BBQ I've had since Smoke & Swine was in town. Staff is awesome and took the time to explain what the items were on the menu. I highly recommend this place. Very affordable!!

Ok, so I am giving three stars for a couple reasons. I am going to start by saying I didn’t really care to much for the food. Now I only had the chicken and the ribs and I haven’t had the chance to try anything else yet. So first thing is the people here are very nice! Super upbeat and helpful. You can definitely tell they love what they do and really appreciate each customer they get. Second, the building it self isn’t all that big. But the setting is really cool. I like the decor and the lights and it’s set up pretty awesome. Clean and well taken care of. Back to the food. The chicken breast I had was ok. I ate about half and was more disappointed that I had to use bbq sauce to give it any flavor. The sauce was really good. But was just a little dry and bland on the chicken. The ribs I ate just one rib and was really unhappy. It felt really chewy and hard to eat and didn’t have much flavor. Overall I was disappointed because all the reviews said it was super amazing. I will try it again eventually and maybe the next time it will be different. it does seem a little high on the price side so might not be right away.

I have eaten at many BBQ joints in Oregon. This is one of two that get it right. If you know good BBQ then you know it is hard to find in the area. This place is worth the trip. The Beans will change your life.

name: Chira's | Restaurant and Catering
address: 189 Liberty St NE, Salem, OR 97301, USA
reviews: Went for brunch on Sunday, best breakfast I have had in a long time. My husband ordered the steak and potatoes, now I am not a potatoes person but theirs are dangerously good. The steak was moist perfectly cooked and seasoned. I ordered the stuffed French toast. I have never tasted it's equal. Coffee was always full and our waiter was very attentive.

Been here a few times and every time was amazing. The very big chicken nachos are amazing. I love some good nachos! Also their tacos are tasty. The southwest in my opinion are the best. I could them every day. They have fair prices on their food Especially for downtown.  Their drinks are great, knowledgeable bartender. Will keep coming back.

I’ve eaten at most restaurants in Salem and all I have to say is this place is the best!! I had the prime rib and my wife had the fettuccine Alfredo. Both dishes came nice and hot and absolutely delicious. This place is the bomb. They were packed and pretty busy service was a bit lacking but the food was with the wait. Much better than I expected in Salem. We will visit them again!! Finally a great place to eat in Salem.

My wife and I had never been there. We heard the food was very good and they had a jazz band playing. Good reasons to go. What happened was it took 35 minutes to get our 1st drink. The server helping us was covering all the tables including a table of 8. Two other guys were behind the bar with the bartender and were shooting the breeze for about 40 minutes before they did anything. Maybe they were off the clock. We stayed because of the music and when the food finally arrived it was very good. The 3 star is for the poor service though our guy was working his but off to get to everyone.

The salads looked good and my soup was excellent but my burger was tasteless. I had to put ketchup on it to add some flavor. One of my friends had pasta and she said it had good flavor but it was dry. The server was very attentive and nice, but it took a long time to get our food even though it wasn’t busy.

name: Xicha Brewing Co.
address: 576 Patterson St NW #140, Salem, OR 97304, USA
reviews: I’ve been to Xicha’s a couple times, have tried quite a few different items and their food is always great. Their pickled onions are the best part. Definitely elevated Mexican dishes. But some of them have been quite messy/messy looking. I really enjoyed the fried avocado but the salad part was kinda just plopped on top. And every time I go there they always forget my main dish and I end up having to take it home because the people I’m with are already done eating.

1st time here, and it was fantastic. Off the beaten path in West Salem, it's a wonderful venue. Full of life and color, the service was as perfect as the food. They offer a $7 flight, and my partner and I both had one. It was a great sampling of the brews they have to offer, and the paella is to die for. Highly recommended! A definite go to.

The food is excellent. Service is pretty good as well . Beer is a hit and miss. I'm a homebrewer so I've made a lot of mediocre beer in my brewing journey. I'll admit that the beer seems to haven't gotten better since they first opened. Getting to know your brewing equipment helps so I'm sure this had a lot to do with it. Not quite 4 stars yet but it's getting there. I continue to go to help support what they're doing. Brewing is a hard business so I appreciate the effort. Not a huge fan of "Latino" theme that clearly caters to non Latino customer base clearly in the non-Latino part of town. It's Salem, so you take what you can get I suppose.

We have been here multiple times end it honestly just keeps getting better. The pictures say it all. Their customer service is spot on, and I love the twist and the amount of thought that goes into each and everyone of their plates. Will recommend them anytime of the day.

This is our second visit to this fun restaurant! We love the staff here-so friendly and helpful! I enjoyed a delicious raspberry margarita with my two tacos. My partner had a couple of his favorite beers and he also had tacos but he also tried the potatoes (papitas) and I went for the homemade corn chips-delicious! Next time I will have the paella again-too good to wait too long!

name: McGrath's Fish House
address: Willamette Town Center, 3805 Center St NE, Salem, OR 97301, USA
reviews: I have been going to McGraths for years. It has always been good. I think the entire chain is now lacking In all departments.  The food was mediocre.  The staff was also mediocre. They need to change with the times and step up their game. I had a bloody Mary, was not good. I do not recommend getting one. I also had the Captains Platter,  the best thing on it was the friend shrimp. My friend had seafood pasta, it was alright. Just overall not as good as they use to be!
We had great service, the food came fast even though they were very busy. It was prepared perfectly and well displayed on the plate.  The amount of shrimp for the price was outstanding.
Always excellent. Today was above and beyond. Noel was our server and he was polite, kind, and on top of our table in the best possible way. A fully earned 5 stars.

I ordered the captain's plate. My friend ordered the shrimp.  Both were excellent in flavor and the amount was huge. The dinner salad was awesome.  Very high quality lettuce.  Service was very good.  I will be back, for the quality, value and service it was well worth it.

My church had a Christmas supper There. Over a month ago customer service was great. Went to this establishment. A few months back after Christmas and they had a dish on the menu called jambalaya and being from south, Louisiana It sure wasn't jambalaya. Was a pasta dish. Not jambalaya And their prices went up. And their portions downsize tremendously. But the food was okay. In the customer service. Was all right.

name: Bari Restaurant and Bar
address: 136 High St SE, Salem, OR 97301, USA
reviews: Love this place. My first experience started out hanging with a friend, and ordering a bunch of appetizers during their happy hour. The food is delicious. My husband and I visit a couple times a month. We love the bone marrow appetizer which you can then take a whiskey luge from. Friendly and knowledgeable staff. The owner is also very friendly and loves to chat with us. Also a nice diversity of beers and cocktails. Love the pomelo cocktail.

Went to birthday dinner with friends who went for the first time. They were wowed. From calamari and shrimp appetizers, mojito and old fashions, to the special pork chop and salmon, every bite was flavorful and scrumptious. The salmon was rolled with shrimp layered on grilled vegetables on top of mashed potatoes about six inches high. No room for dessert. Owner Bruce is always friendly, welcoming and informative.

Bruce, the owner, was also our bartender, and was awesome.  Great cocktails.  House made bread...so good, we bought an entire loaf to take home, which was made fresh while we waited.  Beet salad was fabulous.  We had the specials for our entrees...flank steak with blue cheese and mushroom glace, and the mushroom ravioli.  Superb!  We will be back.
Excellent drinks, fantastic service and tasty snacks. I am interested trying all of the cocktail specials. It was hard to choose one!
Excellent food and service! Meghan was our waitress and was very attentive! Best charcuterie plate and cheese plate in Salem that I have had so far!

name: Nagoya Japanese Steakhouse & Sushi
address: 3760 Center St NE, Salem, OR 97301, USA
reviews: This place is so fun! We brought our kids (8&6) and they just loved the entertainment and the food! My husband and I also get to enjoy a nice time out to a restaurant (which is uncommon) because the kids just love everything going on! You get to watch all the chefs prepare everyone's meals as well so it's a blast. The food is GREAT and the sushi is fresh! (Sorry about the pics, they were a last minute thought because the food was too good!!!)

We were completely wowed by our experience here . They were abled to accommodate my Gluten Free  needs. Everything was so flavorful.  We will definitely be back here to explore more of the great Flavors Nagoya has to offer.  Both plates are the Nagoya Special  with one being scallops and the other Shrimp.  We tried the live oysters and were not disappointed in both presentation and flavor.

My grandson wanted to celebrate his birthday and he picked this place out. I have never been a fan of this place, and especially since a few years back one of our local stations did a segment where they had rodents in the place. The chefs are great. it's the waitress staff that have no clue what customer service is all about. there was 14 of us and one grill. I had about 12 inches of space to eat. They first had us at two tables and moved us to one. I told my daughter we should go elsewhere. but she said her son picked it. So we stayed and I did not order anything, because if I am spending $30.00 on meal. I want to have elbow room and not be bumping elbows. My two cents and I will never go back there or would ever have a meeting with others there.

I always love coming here. The sushi is fresh and delicious, and the beauty of the presentation is delightful. On the hibachi side, the food is always cooked to perfection, and their fried rice is the best I've ever had. The chefs are entertaining, if a little predictable if you've ever been to a hibachi place before. Prices are perhaps premium, but what you get I believe is worth it.

An impressive dining venue, offering table dining, group hibachi dining (and, I believe, a bar?); a seemingly vast menu of food and drink; and, foremost, a very friendly and attentive staff. My first dining experience here guaranteed a repeat visit. Per the photos, the quality exceeded expectations; from the rice, to the tempura and battered chicken, everything was savory and rich in flavour. Strongly recommend the pear sake. I wish this restaurant long-lasting success.

name: China Gourmet
address: 1405 Broadway St NE, Salem, OR 97301, USA
reviews: Our favorite Chinese restaurant in Salem (quite possibly our favorite restaurant in Salem - we've truly never had a bad dish). Our kids eat all the vegetables here, even big chunks of onion, and we credit them with expanding our kid's palates to enjoy more veggies. Tip: they don't joke around with spice, so go mild if you aren't sure, or, try their non spicy dishes first. Some of our favorites are cashew chicken, shrimp fried rice, chicken mushroom noodle, garlic sauce anything, and the curry fried rice (amazing). This is not the greasy, gloppy, MSG laden Chinese dishes you've seen elsewhere in the States - this place is truly perfect.

Amazing, friendly service and great food. 

Edit: Still the best place to go get Chinese food love this place

This is possibly the best Chinese food in Salem, a true gem. The first thing I noticed about the food is how incredibly fresh the produce tastes. The service is super friendly and the restaurant is warm and intimate. Plenty of vegan options as well. Do not skip out on this place!

I’ve driven by this place many times and finally tried it on the recommendation of a friend. I ordered a takeout meal and my wife and I enjoyed it very much. My order consisted of BBQ pork, pot stickers, broccoli chicken, and their crispy gourmet noodles (with BBQ pork, chicken, beef, and shrimp). I will definitely order another takeout meal from China Gourmet the next time I’m heading home from work and hungry for Chinese.

Best Chinese in Salem. This unassuming place had the best food in town. As soon as you order you can hear the cook working the wok and in a few minutes you will be tasting the best Chinese to touch your lips.

name: Almost Home | Restaurant and Steak House
address: 3310 Market St NE, Salem, OR 97301, USA
reviews: My wife and I went here yesterday for breakfast and had a very nice meal. For the two of us we got two meals, a pancake and coffee. We ended up paying $18 plus tip.  It was far better than Denny's, but it's still very much a standard cafe and similar to Shari's pies. Our server was very attentive.

Great place to eat while staying across the street at a hotel on a very rainy night during a road trip. Friendly staff.  Good, hot food.  Comfortable atmosphere.  Even packed us up a desert for later at the hotel.  Hometown good food.

This is a great little breakfast spot for a hearty meal to start your day off on the right track. The homemade biscuits and gravy are simply the best that I've ever had! The put a sausage patty on each biscuit half then smother it with creamy gravy.
Very impressed. Bryce the waiter was exceptional. Super efficient ! Great food, great service. Definitely coming back next time I'm in town!
Nice improvements are being done to place!  All employees work hard. Prices are a bit high for portions of food received. Food is good, service is quick!

name: Flight Deck Restaurant & Lounge
address: 2680 Aerial Way SE, Salem, OR 97302, USA
reviews:
This little gem in Salem, Oregon is one of the places my wife and I will frequent whenever we are in the area.  It's kind of out in the middle of nowhere but that's one of the great appeals of this restaurant.  It sits right on the runway of the Salem Municipal Airport and has been open since the late 1960's.  We love to go there for dinner mostly but have been there a few times for lunch and even brunch.  My wife loves the homemade meatloaf and Chicken Marsala.  I am a HUGE fan of the Chicken Almond Crunch!  I get that almost every time we go for dinner.  
It's a shame at the moment that we are devoid of being able to frequent our favorite eateries. So, while I have some free time, I am happy to post some reviews for places I had been meaning to for quite awhile.  
My wife and I have never had a bad meal here and the atmosphere is casual (Very "aeronautic",  when you sit in the dining area, you will immediately know what I am talking about.), the staff is super friendly and occasionally even the guys in the kitchen have a good time.  They have a full-service bar with cocktails that do not disappoint!  When you enter the building you are sitting on the second floor overlooking the small airport where occasionally you get to see small airplanes both come in and take off from.  In the spring and summer it's especially nice in the evening as you also get to see the colorful sunsets as well.
