Overall this is a wonderful spot with BETTER than average food, good service, nice views and a casual atmosphere.  If you are ever in Salem, my spouse and I highly recommend checking out the Flight Deck Restaurant for any meal!  YES, they have happy-hour too -  from 4 to 6 pm, M-F if I am not mistaken.  Might want to check the website to verify.

I love the setting and the atmosphere!  I really enjoyed the view!  Very nice open space!  Good energy all around! The Flight Deck Scramble was so good!  Very fresh veggies!  A perfect egg scramble!  Very delicious!  Staffs were super friendly and nice!  It was a very enjoyable breakfast with great location!  Excellent service!  I will be back!!

The location is a bit obscure, but I'd go back. The food was very good and pleasantly plated. I thought my sandwich (Off the Runway Melt) was a bit small, but it tasted great.
The plane/airfield theme is cute and it could be fun to bring kids. When we were there (lunch on a Thursday) it was almost empty. The wait staff were very pleasant and accommodating. Apparently my parents have been going here on dates for years, so I guess it doesn't ware out too quick. 
I'll definitely be going back sometime.
Love coming here . People are great food is good. We are staying home now tho. Cant wait to come back  Looking forward to seeing you all again as soon as we can!!

Had breakfast here and the biscuits and gravy were absolutely scrumptious. The biscuits were fluffy and moist. The bacon was crisp and not too salty. And our server Jackie was so friendly and helpful(so was the other server Blake) despite being swamped. They worked as a team to make sure everyone had their order and was satisfied. I would give the servers 10 stars if I could!

name: La Hacienda Real
address: 3690 Commercial St SE, Salem, OR 97302, USA
reviews: The food is terrific! Service is only slightly less than terrific. The staff is always friendly. Tables for groups are packed a little too tight. I'd suggest eating there anytime but not in a group. Truly a great place to eat.

Margarita is the best in town for flavor.   Food was hot and fresh however a bit lacking in seasoning.   Would like to return to try other dishes.  They have so many choices and there are excellent explanations in for each dish in their extensive menu.

We were seated promptly, server gave us just enough time to make up our minds - but did not make us wait too long to return and take our order. They did not mind that we took our time and talked with our family who we had not seen for some time to catch up. Some green sauce was requested instead of salad dressing for one of the salad, it never arrived with the meal. The server did finally check back after the salad was almost done being eaten. This won't stop us from visiting again.
Good food.. Friendly staff.. The prices are a little high but the portions are huge... Prepare to be served a big plate.   The menu is like a book though- alot of options hard to decide.
We love this place. It has the best flour tortillas ever. Great friendly service. It is a bit of a drive from where I live, but the food is amazing.

name: White's Restaurant
address: 1138 Commercial St SE, Salem, OR 97302, USA
reviews: This was a great place to eat. It was a very affordable restaurant with good food. The staff was welcoming.  The restaurant was clean for an older restaurant.  The bathrooms are small and pretty clean. The pancakes where fluffy and delicious. I wasn't impressed with the corn beef hash. It was okay but I've had better. Food quality is good and the prices are even better.

We had the best experience! When my niece has a sleepover, we always go somewhere she hasn't gone for breakfast the next morning. On a Sunday, we arrived with my 2 year old in tow. We picked our table and were quickly greeted by our waitress who brought water and took our drink orders. Without even asking she put my son's juice in a cup with lid and straw. She even brought crayons and a coloring menu even though we'd brought him things to do
 She even asked beforehand. It was so respectful.
We placed our orders and holy cow everything was delicious. My niece raved about her french toast with crunchies! I had the 15 1/2 and was so happy. The sausages were a bit spicier than expected but still tasty. 
I am so glad our tradition brought us back to White's. It was a really great meal and so comfortable. We will be back again for sure.

I've been searching for a good diner and have not had luck in Corvallis, but I will absolutely make the drive up to White's when I have my next craving! The turkey club was everything I wanted it to be: super buttery perfectly toasted sourdough, delicious oven roasted turkey, and crispy bacon. Service was very friendly, too! No wonder they've been open since 1936! Can't wait to go back and try breakfast 😋

Whites is fantastic! Friendly staff, great food and a small town cafe feel. Lots of regulars, but friendly to new faces. I felt very comfortable and welcome. The omelets are filling and yummy and the hash browns are crispy but not burned. Loved it!
Always friendly and the food is great. My wife and I get Don's big mess and split it with a pancake on the side and always leave full.

name: Venti's Cafe + Basement Bar
address: 325 Court St NE, Salem, OR 97301, USA
reviews: Vent's Cafe Basement Bar is a wonderful treat in Salem.  The beverages are excellent, great beer and wine selection plus a full bar.  The menu provides an outstanding selection and variety, generous portions, and reasonable prices.  When you step down the stairs and enter Venti's Basement Bar you truly feel as through you are stepping back in time to the era of prohibition and the speakeasy.  Give Venti's Basement Bar a try, you'll be coming back for more.  If you find the review and pictures helpful, please give them a like! Thank you

A friend recommended Venti's for the vegan options, and I was pleasantly surprised when I walked in and found three separate menus, one regular, one for vegan options, and one for gluten free options. It made it incredibly easy to find something to order and be certain that it was vegan. We ordered the chorizo burger with tots and the grilled cheese with spicy tots. The food was exceptionally good, and the service was top notch. The tap list for beer had over 20 options and they offered pints as well as imperial pints. Overall I really enjoyed the restaurant, the prices are a bit higher, but after tasting the food I would say it's worth it.

I came here tonight with two friends. The atmosphere was really cute and had a really nice flow to it. We walked up to the register to order, I got the spicy Mac and cheese, my friend got the plain Mac and cheese, my other friend got a mushroom blue cheese burger, and we ordered an appetizer of spicy tots. The wait wasn’t bad at all, our food arrived about 5-10 minutes after we ordered. Although the food wasn’t bad, it wasn’t super great either. My spicy mac was spicy, but had very little flavor. I feel like it definitely needed some thing. One of my friends said the same thing about her plain mac, saying that she thought it lacked salt. My other friend said his burger had great buns, and sauce, but again said it lacked seasoning. However, the spicy tots were amazing and I would definitely come back just for those.

Venti’s has an awesome menu for vegetarians, vegans, and meat-eaters! Their artichoke spinach dip is amazing and their bowls are tasty, too! Plus, they always have a good beer on tap. I can’t wait to go back!

The food was spot on. The staff- -front and back--are concerned with making good, healthy, tasty food. 
Huge selection of options on three menus  (Paleo, gluten free and non restricted)

They have entertainment and a full bar.
Noisy as all get out, even on the Monday evening we were there. College aged crowd.

We are from out of town, the restaurant and business district is an interesting and tasty visit.

name: Busick Court Restaurant
address: 250 Court St NE, Salem, OR 97301, USA
reviews: Really good food. Big portions as well. We had to wait for a while to get our menus  because our waiters were busy talking but other than that they were friendly and it was good.

I was seated immediately even though the place was crowded. The food was hot, filling and flavorful. The prices are decent. Good service. The first impression as a first time customer, Busick Court Restaurant is quaint and has a very historical ambiance and decor. I had the Chicken Fried Steak, Eggs and Fried Potatoes with Coffee and Toast. My breakfast was delicious.
The environment was very pleasing.  It made me feel very welcome.  A very charming little place.  The food was exceptional and the service was very good too! Will definitely go again.
The food was delicious, the place was packed with people & we enjoyed our time with sisters for brunch 😊

Finally got a chance to give this place a try. We arrived Saturday a little after 10am I believe. Waited around 15 minutes for a table, service was great, we received our drinks and placed our orders shortly after sitting down. 

I ordered the Chorizo Rancheros. It was wonderful, great flavors, nicely sized portion. I chose biscuits and gravy as my side. Awesome biscuits and gravy I must say. Super tasty gravy with a fluffy light biscuit. I'd definitely be back to try some of the many other items off the menu.

name: Venti's Cafe + Taphouse
address: 2840 Commercial St SE, Salem, OR 97302, USA
reviews: I've never eaten here before until the other day and now I've been here twice.   You guys if you like health conscious food made to order by passionate people, this is definitely a must go to.  I was absolutely shocked that I got these 2 fish tacos for only $8.25. If you were in Portland these would cost you $12 all day long just for 2 tacos.  Organic corn tortilla with amazing fish and toppings.  This is definitely my new go to spot for beer and food. Service is spot on without being overbearing and the place is really trendy on the inside.

This place is amazing! Great parking, easy to turn into and get out off. The atmosphere is intimate but fun at the same time. It's a bit like Cheers! Hang around on a Monday night for trivia, it's a hoot. The food is great. Many options for those that have dietary needs or specialties. Great selection of Taps as well that rotate and you have the option to fill a growler. Thank you Venti's!!!!

I can't recommend this place enough. The sweet potato fries are the best I have ever had. Every meal I have had here has been so delicious! I love that they offer the Vegan Beyond Burger. They have lots of meat free and gluten free options. Staff is really friendly. Amazing restaurant.

Nice comfort food with lots of vegan options.  The "burger" with Beyond Burger was really good and of course, tots are always great. My wife tried the street tacos and they were good but I don't like how you can't mix and match (they said we had to get two of the same).  Great beer on tap from local brewery and the vegan nachos were good but we ate way too much food.  I would recommend this place and look forward to hitting it up again the next time through Salem.

The food here never fails to disappoint. Plus the play area is wonderful. Normally at restaurants it can be difficult with small children especially overly hyper ones but not here, I can go over and he can play with toys while we wait for our food. Staff have always been extremely friendly as well!

name: Gerry Frank's Konditorei
address: 310 Kearney St SE, Salem, OR 97302, USA
reviews: Stopped here for dessert on a recommendation of a friend. Oh My Goodness! We ended up having half a sandwich (egg salad which was delicious) & a cup of soup (spicy asparagus which also was delicious and not terribly spicy), plus a chocolate cake with butter, mocha, chocolate mousse for  filling & frosting for dessert. My friend and I split the cake because the piece was huge! We also had a hot mocha to go with our cake. Everything was fresh and delish. The employees were all very friendly and helpful. And the atmosphere is so cute. We will definitely be going back & recommending it to our friends.

My wife and I came for desert because of people telling us how good it is. They were not kidding. I had carrot cake and my wife had chocolate peanut butter mousse tort. Both were awesome. We'd definitely recommend a stop here. We plan on stopping again to check out other things on their menu. We had excellent attentive service by a young waiter. No question about leaving a good tip for him. Smaller  place but well worth the visit

Colorful, bubbly little cafe with superb desserts. The mounds coconut chocolate cake and the mocha almond mousse torte are fabulous! 
We were seated quickly and had a pleasant waitress.
It is well worth your time to drop by this charming shop.

Very friendly service.  The lunch choices are many and are so well done.  The desserts are very high quality, numerous and of great variety.  So much so that my child choose a cake type he'd never had - coconut puff.  This is a fun way to try new things! The interior is very clean and gives the impression of a European bistro though my use of the French word is incongruous with the fact it is modeled after a German cake store.

You have to try all of their dessert selections! 
My group got 4 different cakes, and it seemed like each one was better than the last. 
This place maintains a small town cafe feel and it seemed like everyone knew each other and was very friendly. 
Their savory food items were spectacular as well. All around, a great place to eat and catch up with friends.

name: Pietro's Pizza Salem
address: 1637 Hawthorne Ave NE, Salem, OR 97301, USA
reviews: This place is a good value for the family friendly crowd. Their pizza is good if you like a thin crust pizza. Say have a small salad bar also available. The staff are hardworking, and accommodating. They have an arcade that is discreetly set off to one side of the building so that you can still enjoy your meal in peace without the constant clamour of video games and bells clanging. The miniature golf is actually pretty well done. The lighting and sound effects Are great. And there laser tag arena is really quite good. Overall, we've had some fun nights there with the kids. And some pretty good pizza too.
So much fun!  Laser tag!  Putt putt glow in the dark 3d!  Arcade and ticket prize booth!  Pizza!  We had 3 birthday parties here, lots of fun!

Our first time to this place first impression very well was greeted quickly professional  with a smile. They claim to be  the number one pizza place, sadly I disagree little bit of a high price on the pizza, and sadly they don't offer any specials.
There macaroni and cheese is served at room temperature I had to ask them to heat it up which they happily did. 
About the salad bar, my wife and I were waiting for this young man to clean it up and refill and as he did he took his sweet time as if no one was around and at the end he did refill them but then he didn't clean on the surface. We will try them again so hopefully we'll have a better experience.

Really interesting place! My first time. The pizza was really good but the games were par. Only did the games, didn't do the put-put or laser tag. I had the 3 yo with me and she only liked 1 game that started eating coins.  If your kid is over 8ish then will enjoy the games.  Under 6, not so much. Overall,  great people, really helpful.  Nice place.  I would go back, especially when she gets older.

I was really hesitant about dining here after reading the reviews, especially for my sons birthday. I tried looking for other venues & am so glad I failed!! 

We had a wonderful time!! The venue was clean and inviting. Plenty of seating for big parties with room for the kids to run without loosing site of them. 

I whole-heartedly recommend the Mediterranean Pizza as one of your choices. It was so delicious!! The prices were better than I even planned for and the pitchers of drinks came with 5 refills! 

The family had a blast and we will be back!!

name: Yan Yan Chinese Cuisine
address: 3305 Lancaster Dr NE, Salem, OR 97305, USA
reviews: I've been coming here For 6 or 7 years and they are as polite and fresh as ever. Great quality for the price, the best you're going to find in Salem that still allows combination meals and special requests. Theyve never messed up one of my orders or made me feel like they were too busy to serve me . Love supporting this business!

Placed a to go order 40 minutes before closing and still fresh as if they had just opened.  I really appreciate that because I was super hungry and wanted a good meal to end the day and they didn’t let me down.  And for everything you get with the orange chicken dinner special is GREAT!!! Soup always comes with. A++++ 1

My boyfriend and I got take out for our 3 year anniversary. This is our favorite restaurant and we've been coming here for about 3 years. The staff made everything really simple and easy for ordering and pick up. The food was still amazing and fresh by the time we got home, and the portions were so big that we even had enough for seconds the next day!

Yan Yan is our go to restaurant when we're in Salem, OR. I'm always amazed at the quality and quantity of food for a ridiculously low price. Food tastes fresh and is never over-sauced. Service is excellent and efficient. We always take home half our order for a later meal. We always leave a big tip since it is such a great bargain. We want them to stay in business.

This is an American style Chinese restaurant. Decent food decent prices. Good staff. Seems to be busy with lots of patrons. They accommodate well and are friendly with kids and families. It is our go to restaurant for Chinese style food.

name: Thai Cuisine of Salem
address: 2916 Commercial St SE, Salem, OR 97302, USA
reviews:
Awesome food! Love getting my Thai food fix here. Their curries are very good. Right on point with the spice level I ordered.

Thank you very much!!
Absolutely amazing food! Great service! I will be coming back!

Not the best thai food I've ever had, but it was really good. I will be coming back purely because I have a lot of vegan friends and they have an expansive vegan menu and even offer multiple plant-based meat alternatives. The service was also super friendly. Happy to see more places cater to vegan folk and have a menu they can order from without having to go through all of the substitutions and worry of the kitchen forgetting about them. Very exciting to have a place where people without dietary restrictions and plant based folks can feel comfortable and welcome :)

We looked for a place with variety and vegetarian, vegan and gluten free options. This place was perfect. One person had vege stir fry that was not spicy, one had a noodle vegetable dish with a pinch of spice and one had yellow curry that was delicious. Everyone was pleased and there were so many more options to try on another visit. The owner was willing to customize a dish to specific food sensitivities and the dining area was tastefully painted with attractive paintings and quiet background music. We will definitely return and make this a regular spot for dining for our family.
Very cute and cozy Thai Restaurant on Commercial. The Pineapple Fried rice and Thai iced tea were very flavorful and the appetizers were delicious. Definitely worth a visit!

name: Kim Huong Restaurant
address: 2950 Silverton Rd NE, Salem, OR 97301, USA
reviews:
This is a decent place with a handful of vegetarian options. We had the crispy veggie rolls. They were tasty and came with a pretty standard sauce. For our meals we had Spicy Tofu with Lemongrass and Tofu with Mixed Vegetables. Both were good, but the sauce on the Spicy Tofu was amazing - it has peanuts, though, which weren't listed in the description. It was fine for us, but wouldn't be for everyone. The rice seemed as though it had been sitting for a while - a little hard and not easy to break apart with chopsticks.

Chopsticks are available, but you may have to ask for them. Same with hot tea. They prefer that you order by number, not by the name of the dish. They brought fortune cookies with the bill.

I have eaten here many times over a couple of decades, and while the menu has changed some, and prices have crept up some, the food is always outstanding. The vegetables are always fresh and crisp, the sauces are always mouth-watering good, and every dish is just right. This is a family owned and operated place where the family clearlr cares about getting it right. I have eaten at Vietnamese restaurants around the US, especially the DC area, in Europe, especially around Cologne, and while I have eaten at some other good places, and I have eaten at some way more expensive Vietnamese places, I have never eaten at one I would say is better than Kim Huong in Salem. Always plenty of room to park, and one can easily get a good meal and not be late getting back from lunch.
Showed up here 40 minutes to closing on a Friday and this place was busy. That's the sign of good food.  We ordered and got the food pretty quick. Very enjoyable I would highly recommend.

Sorry, were hungry enough to start eating and not enough time to snap our ordered dishes before they got “torn up”.  Kids loved the food, wife and I as Pho lovers approve it here as well. Portions aren’t huge, but I believe that’s perfect to keep one from overeating, considering that we did it even finish ours. Sunday night they were full of clients, to me it just means that this is a proper place with good eats! If you want 5 star everything, go to a brand new construction spot with fresh paint and new toilet fixtures, this is a good neighborhood spot, seems to be served by owners themselves!

Been eating here for years and the food taste just as good. The pho is very delicious perfect for cold weather or anytime you’re in the mood for a good soup, the roasted chicken is also a great dish they serve. It comes with rice and some sauces. The spring rolls are a great appetizer they’re good in size and the peanut sauce that it comes with it good too.

name: Cuisine India
address: 1220 State St, Salem, OR 97301, USA
reviews: Love this place. We go there for buffet lunch several times a month. The food is very very good and there are enough dishes to choose from.  The price is great also. We have never been there when it was not packed which tells me that so many others love it too.!😁

Very clean, excellent service. Fast delivery. Indian tea w/milk was tasty. Rice very good. Naan with vegetables (#69) excellent. Chicken dish with vegetables (#39), my main course was disappointing. The chicken texture was rubbery, like boiled vs baked and the vegetables WERE FROM A FROZEN BAG OF MIXED VEGGIES! As an organic gardener whose main diet primarily consists of fresh, organic veggies, i was very disappointed in the dish. The sauce tasted like curried stew gravy. Don't think it was cooked fresh for my dish. I would rather wait longer to eat, and be served fresh food. I will try this place again with friends who like Indian food. The prices were very reasonable. About $23 which includes the tip. The owner nor cashier said thank you, or asked me to come back soon. I looked at him to say good bye, he shifted his eyes away. Awkward.

I ordered for pickup. Quantity and quality is very good 👍 so yummy 😋 

Going to visit again

Good Indian restaurant in Salem. Low prices and huge quantities. Their tandoori is great. Most of the items were kind of bland, may be due to lack of more Indians in the city. Good wine collection though. Their buffet options are really good, must try. Too many varieties at a very low price. Over all good restaurant, just a little more desi touch needed in taste.

I often take my friends to this place with my highest recommendations. I  go to this restaurant often. This recommendation is always successful. The dishes they serve are flavorable and the crew is welcoming and cooperative. always when we go to this place we enjoy a delightful evening.  I warmly recommend this restaurant.

name: Epilogue Kitchen and Cocktails
address: 130 High St SE, Salem, OR 97301, USA
reviews: Go support local businesses and have good inspiring interesting food and cocktails. I love that the kitchen is right upfront, highly visible chef etc. Because the dishes are varied and creative some do miss the mark for certain palates. But life is not about eating the same thing over and over. Be adventurous and open to new things. The staff have also been really nice on both visits. They do have a full bar and again some very creative drinks. We had a cornmeal cocktail and it was wild. Not my favorite but I def went back for more sips. I recommend sharing with your group. Go support local. They also do a discount if your seeing a show at the Elsinore.

Excellent food, quite a unique menu.  This place is a hidden gem, right under your nose downtown.  Definitely check out this owner operated business.  The owner is an awesome, friendly guy, who you will usually catch behind the grill.  I highly recommend this as a Salem must eat.  Try the Western Philadelphia Cheese Steak!!

The service was prompt and kind. Very clean atmosphere. Small- but quaint. Perfect for our table or 4. Appetizer were FAST! Drinks were chilled and quick. Dinner options are unique and so full of flavor and color. I will return for sure. Great date night spot. I was impressed.
Have tried this place twice. Both times have been an excellent experience. Prompt, friendly service, great cocktails and tasty food. Tried the ox tail and the crab cakes. Both were fantastic!
It's fried chicken week!  Crispy and tasty!  Has good flavors!  Very good!  Wonderful service!  I like the biscuits too!

name: The Coin Jam
address: 439 Court St NE, Salem, OR 97301, USA
reviews: Great place 21 or older arcade! Tons of older and some new arcade games. Fair prices to play. Food and drinks are also tasty. For people playing the games there are two change machines and an ATM. Just a good place to hang with friends to have a drink and play some games!  There always seems to be a different arcade here when I drop in. Also for all those Pokemon Go fans there are two pokestops near by that can be swiped 🙂
What a trip to your 1980's childhood! Food seems to have a Scottish flare. It's good. Good beer selection. They have coin dispensers. It's easy to spend money there!

So much fun and a great group of people we were lucky to have behind the counter. I had a big ice cream cake for my partners birthday and they cleared out their freezer to stash it for me, cut it and brought out the plates and silverware. We'll definitely be going back for some more memories.

A really awesome arcade and bar. So many really fun vintage games and newer ones. The staff there is also super nice!! The only thing I wish is there were a few more non-alcoholic drink options, but it was such a blast it didn't bother me that much. And the rootbeer I did get was very tasty. Highly recommend if you're looking for something fun to do.
As with all arcades it's a little on the noisy side, but they got a decent pinball selection and I would figure pretty good on the alcohol too. Food is above average

name: Sybil's Omelettes
address: 2373 State St, Salem, OR 97301, USA
reviews: I'm not personally wild about the omelettes, but this place has a lot of other things to love.  The coffee is the best sit in in town for starters, only two places all my life I can take the coffee black and Sybil's is one of them.  Their lunch sandwich options are phenomenal as well as the restaurant made dipping sauce that comes with all their fry options.  I haven't had a chance to try all of their options yet but give me some time and I'll be sure to catch up.  😉
Really welcoming, busy place. Solo but didn't feel odd or left out. Generous food portions, lots of choice. Staff very helpful and cheerful.

Great family place for down home good food. Every  omelet combination you can think of plus the diced ham with cream cheese and eggs are really nice. I normally just let my wife order a meal and I'll get a Waffle because they are the best and the portions are big enough that my wife shares her leftovers.

Food was delicious. Portions were smaller than the last time I ate there. Way too crowded. Tables were too close together and at one point I had to move the entire table into the walkway to get out from between the tables on either side of us. Very loud. It was hard to have a conversation. But... the food was still delicious.
Wow!  The place might not look like it, however the food was delicious,  service was great, portions are huge and the staff is friendly.

name: Olive Garden Italian Restaurant
address: 1302 Lancaster Dr NE, Salem, OR 97301, USA
reviews: Today was our first time doing pick up. We were so pleased with everything. It was all packaged nicely. I mentioned extra peppers for the birthday girl they gave us lots. They also added a birthday dessert that said Happy Birthday on it. And with all the Covid precautions going on theirs were superb. Thank you so much we will do this again.

Best deal is $12 all you can eat pasta. They have $5 drinks, $5 take home entrees. I recommend the meat sauce or a blend of the garlic and mushroom sauce.  Coffee is great. Salad and bread sticks are a favorite.  Tiramisu and cheesecake are excellent dessert choices.  Coming here just for coffee and dessert is an option.

It's a good to great experience depending on your server, but we seem to usually have great servers. And that puts it at 5 star awesome because the service and food are consistently great.

my wife and i have had the pasta pass for the past 3 years. its a great deal and we love coming to olive garden. they have a great deal on pretty good pasta. have always had great service and with call ahead seating haven't had to wait more then 10 minutes usually if its really busy. i chose 4 stars today as one thing i do notice is that the consistency of the food is not great. one day its super hot and fresh and cooked right, and the next day its under done and cold. one day its SUPER saucy and the next it may be just right. its a little issue but its not one that has stopped us from coming and loving it.

Not bad. My server was great. He was very friendly & attentive. He also made sure to explain everything & show me in detail how everything worked (the tablet like devices they have on the tables) as I've never used them. It was a pleasant visit & the food was good. Not great but good.

Went on New Years Eve. Even though the place was packed, they staff were calm and happy in the busy atmosphere. Our waiter was awesome and attentive. We didn't have to wait long to be seated or get our food and quick refills. Despite how slammed they were. So impressed and love this place!

name: Geppetto's Italian Restaurant
address: 616 Lancaster Dr NE, Salem, OR 97301, USA
reviews: I've been hearing good things about Geppetto's and finally got the opportunity to visit. The food was fantastic and the service was friendly and timely. We sat in the bar because the dining room was full. Not going to complain about that. The bartender was friendly and knowledgeable. I highly recommended.

Could this be Salem's best kept secret? I think so! I LOVE Italian food & have tried them all in this area...never found one worth going to twice. Today was Geppetto's turn. AMAZING & AUTHENTIC! The atmosphere, service, & food were outstanding! Definitely the best I've had in The Valley! And that Minestrone soup....it doesn't get better than theirs! The icing on our cake? They DELIVER! I HIGHLY recommend Geppetto's for Italian dishes, and pizza. That meat sauce....🌟🌟🌟🌟🌟!!!

Mediocre and overpriced. We were greeted and seated promptly, our server came out quickly and took our orders. Very polite. Dinner salads were iceburg lettuce, shredded carrots and one cucumber slice. No tomatoes. My family had pasta dishes; portions were fine, but they didn't taste all that great. Flat, overcooked, lightly seasoned. Dinner for two adults and two kids, no drinks was $47. If grandma wants to go out for Italian food, has never left Salem and has never had proper Italian food, this is the place.

Last night I decided to order Geppetto’s for dinner through delivery since I have always been a fan of their pizza. After receiving it and noticing that the experience was not up to par with their usual amazing  quality, I decided to call in and explain what had happened. It’s always scary to call in to give feedback as some people don’t respond well, however my experience was incredible and I want to thank Geppetto’s for an incredible follow through! 

I spoke with both the husband and wife owners and was pleasantly surprised with their response. I calmly explained some of the issues with my order and I was told a few things: 

1. We are so sorry this happened and thank you for calling in because we would not know otherwise. We take this as an opportunity to do better next time.

2. How can we make this right? 

Key factors in running a successful business with return customers! Julie (one of the owners) offered to replace my entire meal ($34 + tip worth) whenever I wanted it, and said she would inform her staff to make sure that they redo my order correctly and make it right the next time. 

Businesses and restaurants are going to make mistakes. No entity is perfect. However, the way you handle your mistakes says a lot about you and the way you run it. I am a very happy customer who will rave about the service I have received. Thank you Geppetto’s for making it right and being so kind in the process. You will always have my business!

The only place I've found in Salem that makes Chicago-style thin crust pizza, which is THE BEST style of pizza. Apparently it's also called tavern-style. I have been so disappointed with pizza since moving to Oregon. I've tried nearly a dozen places. This place is the only place I've found with what I consider really good pizza in Salem.

name: Lucky Garden
address: 4157 Rickey St SE, Salem, OR 97317, USA
reviews:
I have been a long time customer but no more tonight.  I will most likely not go out for this reason.  I called for take out and was told the ‘combos’ were sold out.  Ironically I can order each individual item for 3 times the price.  Now of course I get 3 times the food this way right.  I guess what bothers me most is the customer service has ALWAYS been amazing here.  During the COVID-19 I feel everyone is feeling the pressure and any business experiencing high volumes should be extremely happy to have this available.  My family wanted the comfort of this place at home tonight and I mostly feel disappointed and taken advantage of as a consumer.  I called back and explained you can’t be out of order and in the next sentence be told I can order each individual item separately. I was then handed over to the manager as the original person in the phone understood my concern.  The second person (possibly the manager) explained they were extremely busy tonight and his staff couldn’t handle the extra burden of making combos.  I thanked him for his honesty, and yet still seem just as confused. Perhaps I’m lacking in restaurant experience, but as the customer I’m left feeling it was more about making money in a time the consumer is already “splurging” and supporting local businesses.  Before you call me a ‘Karen’ please know our family order would have been $40.25 with combos, and $72.50 ordering each item separately.   
Lucky Garden, if you care to retain long term customers, make this right, & I’ll happily change my review the moment you do.  I want zero for free, I want to be treated the same as if you were open and had me sitting in your restaurant without stay-at-home orders.   :-(
Best Chinese food I've had in Salem since moving here 3 years ago! Fresh and perfectly cooked. Lots of veggies in the Chicken Stir Fried Noodles and cooked just right. Highly recommended.

This is definitely a place I would take my friends and family! It is soo fresh, and very affordable. One thing I love is the consistency of their food quality as well as the time it comes out. They both serve simple dishes such as sweet and sour pork, or adventurous plates such as salt and pepper squid, both in which they execute perfectly. I highly recommend Lucky Garden!! ❤️💯👌

This is my favorite Chinese restaurant & I treat myself every other week. The food is awesome & you get a whole meal.... soup, entrees, hot tea & fortune cookie. . Lunch specials are the most reasonably priced in town. . Restroom is super clean & the service is exceptional.  Check it out!

I enjoyed the green beans and beef lunch special for under $7. It came with hot tea, soup and a spring roll. THE BEST I HAVE EVER HAD thus far! Everything was cooked to absolute perfection! So Sooo good. I finished everything, savoring each bite. The spring roll was flaky and crispy! Perfect! Perfect service, perfect portions, perfectly cooked-TRY this place!

name: Cafe Yumm! | Candalaria Crossing
address: 2755 Commercial St SE #100, Salem, OR 97302, USA
reviews: Cafe Yumm is my go-to when I’m looking for something quick and healthy. I always get their smoky bowl and am so in love with their sauce that I keep it in stock at my home at all times. It’s so good!!
Average Cafe Yumm, which means it's amazing! Delicious, guilt-free bowls and plates, friendly service at this location too!

Constantly messing up my order. Not hard; vegan and no sauce. Every time, I have to drive back, because there is sauce or sour cream hidden in the middle of the bowl I order. They always apologize and give me a coupon to come back for a "free" med bowl, to make it up. Which I appreciate, but it shouldn't be necessary. The food is very good and the temph is really good. But I'm allergic to the sauce and need my food dairy free. It is what it is. The ginger cookies are fantastic, btw. Even with the errors I have in my orders, I still enjoy the food, when I get my correct order.

Really appreciate the outstanding service here at Cafe Yumm in the Candalaria Crossing mall.  They allow almost any substitution so I can get my vegan (dairy free) gluten free meal.  Nice clean tables and restrooms too:)
Quite possible one of the best choices one could make for a healthyish fast food meal.  And it tastes really good too!

name: Fuji Rice Time
address: 159 High St SE, Salem, OR 97301, USA
reviews: We love this place. Although they might not have a huge selection like big places, what they do have is service with a smile and high quality, fresh fish. The latter being the most important at a sushi restaurant. The best in Salem IMHO.

I just had the best sushi experience ever! This place serves delicious, fresh, and authentic sushi. I tried the Ladybug roll and it was phenomenal. Hands down the best sushi place I've tried in Salem!
The Tuna Trail is fantastic! Always great service and fresh, quality food. We tell all our friends who like sushi to go there and have turned non-sushi eating friends into sushi lovers.
Great sushi! Amazing staff. If you are in downtown Salem definitely a place to go and bring the family, they have the room!
Best around! Thanks James.

name: The Original Momiji Sushi Restaurant
address: 4590 Silverton Rd NE, Salem, OR 97305, USA
reviews: Always a pleasure coming back here to the best Sushi in Salem, Oregon.  Thanks!

I've been eating here since it opened. It started off with near perfect food and service then I feel it took a bit of a fall as the original crew slowly left, but they seem to have got it back together. I was very happy with our food and service tonight and will continue to eat here as much as I can justify.

I have eaten here several times over the last 6 years. Usually very pleased with the quality of food received. Except for yesterday I felt like maybe the person who made my food was new? I will post a photo. There is so little ingredients in my sushi roll that there is actually an extra amount of rice rolled inside the seaweed to make the roll "normal" sized.

This "original" location offers a more authentic/Japenese-styled venue for sushi. If you like restaurants that are unique and homey, this location will feel like a hidden gem; if you like eating in restaurants that are more spacious and contemporary, I recommend their West Salem location. Either way, the food is good and the specials and combos have attractive value!

Been here multiple times over a few years. Used to be very happy with the food and service. Though the last time I've gone and the food I just received today was sub par. Rice was obviously old and mushy, my girlfriends tempura was soggy and under battered. Her sauce was almost vinegar. 
On top of it, I called in to take out and got put on hold for 10 minutes to get hung up on. Had to call back to place my order.
Seems the place is going downhill.

name: Wild Pineapple Grill
address: 1255 Howard St SE, Salem, OR 97302, USA
reviews: Always look at their website to make sure they are open. The owners do travel back and forth to the islands so making sure that a long trek isn't done in futility, look at their facebook site and verify. This last trip, they put up a new fence around the location. Reminds me of some of the fencing on the islands. It does add to the charm of the place and makes it in my opinion - easily more pleasant for walk ups to sit down and eat.. What is my Friday meal? Poke with brown rice - extra sauce - hot & spicy. Two orders because if I get it and not bring any back for the better half ...... Also a pulled pork bowl with the brown rice. Is this a place I travel 10 miles for? Well, it is 15 miles from my house. Going into Salem on a Friday, I plan on stopping here. Why Friday? That is the only day for Poke.

Staff is what makes this place great. They are so kind a genuine. You can tell they are happy and that they love what they do. Small little corner lot in Salem. For a food truck, the food is great, full of flavor. The menu is kept simple with limited options. Dishes are fairly plain, your choice if bowl, plate, platter or a few others. They also have daily specials. Nice little spot to check out!!
Their Hawaiian food is so Delicious ! The people making it are the sweetest.. Thank you
Wonderful Tri-tip stew...I was recently told by a Chinese Medicinal Masseuse that I eat too fast. But, I truly couldn’t help it with this dish mmm mmm mmm

If memory serves, the owner is from Maui.  That's a great way to start authentic grinds.  We've tried Hawaiian time and it was doodoo on a platter.  So, husband was almost hesitant and still very hopeful.  He got kalua pig and a poke bowl.  He was in paradise.  He ate it fast.

name: Garibaldi | Mexican Restaurant & Cantina
address: 1111 Edgewater St NW, Salem, OR 97304, USA
reviews: Quick dinner before a show and it was ok.. Average eats for a Mexican restaurant. Ordered the 3 tacos was hoping for street tacos but got deep fried instead. The restaurant was not busy and the staff were not pleasant. Never did get a drink refill or asked if things were ok.
Excellent food. Had a good time. Very nice customer service 👌
We have always ate here and have had excellent service but today we waited for an 1hr for our food.

Two of us had the Chile verde. Pork was dry, they don't cook it in sauce but just put the dried out pork on top of the sauce. Lousy tortillas. Very disappointed. Try La Hacienda real for much better food.

Our favorite Mexican restaurant in Salem. Family owned.
The food is amazing and the staff are courteous and friendly.You won't find better in Salem...Straight up!

name: Kuong Chan's Chinese Restaurant
address: 2290 Fairgrounds Rd NE, Salem, OR 97301, USA
reviews: Oh my gosh! My 1st time here and so delicious! And large amounts of food. I will be returning for sure!! So glad to see them wearing masks and gloves too. Very kind man that brought out my food. This is my new favorite Chinese restaurant in Salem! Thank you! 😊

First I'll just say...You should eat here.
Now I'll tell you why. We have driven by this place a hundred times. Can't tell you why we never stopped,we just didn't.
Last week we did. It is now my go to spot for Chinese. Thirty two years in Salem for me and I've had some pretty good Chinese. I judge it by the fact that I lived in San Francisco for five years and I ate a lot of Chinese food. In SF's Chinatown there are literally hundreds of small Chinese restaurants.It is of this experience that I say this, Eat here.
Personal favs: Pepper salted Shrimp. The Hot & Sour soup(so good) and of course the Beef Brocolli. Seriously,everything we've tried has been amazing.

Got the Kung Pao Chicken to go. Real good flavor, though a tad too much rice.  Greeted by a very friendly owner.
Will be back
Best hot sour soup in town!  Always good, fresh and served by friendly people.
Great food, no msg and fantastic prices.  Highly recommend if you are looking for the best Chinese restaurant in Salem.

name: Momiji Japanese Restaurant
address: 3411 Commercial St SE, Salem, OR 97302, USA
reviews: Had a excellent experience in here with my wife. The food arrived rapidly and the customer service is just excellent. Prices are affordable.
Food was very good. Wait staff did just what was required nothing above...brought our bill and no asking if we wanted anything else first.
The waitresses I've met are lovely, the atmosphere is comfortable, and the sushi is fantastic!!! Plus they're affordable! 10/10 recommend.

Not to be confused with the other two restaurants in Salem with the same name. Different management. I love the other two and went here thinking it was affiliated, so I was a little disappointed. However, the service was friendly & attentive; the venue was clean. Think a rebranding would help set this place apart.
This is always a solid choice. The presentation is usually very nice and the staff is friendly. The fish seems really fresh.

name: Cachet Tamale Shop
address: 1105 Wallace Rd NW, Salem, OR 97304, USA
reviews: This place is delicious! Their tamales are very  filling and the black beans and rice they serve with them are super tasty!

Have a look at my reviews I don't give everybody 5 stars.
Great customer service the lady I spoke with was genuine and nice.
This place is great, authentic tamales also Guatemalan tamales.
Good prices $6 a tamale plate, two tamales cilantro rice and some great black beans that actually have flavor!
I also seen on the menu half dozen tamales $10 and a dozen for $20.
I would recommend this place.

Love this place!! Pork tamales are so good that I could eat here every day! I like to get a dozen to share with my family throughout the week but they never make it past a few days before they are eaten up.😋

The tamale plate is simply delicious! The tamales are not what you are normally used to, these are made with being covered in banana leaf, similar to what the Hawaiians do with their cooking, the result is a delicious and moist tamale unlike the Mexican tamale with can be and almost is dry because of corn husk covering. If you are looking for something different to enrich your palate, this is the place.

This place is a hidden little gem. Love the tamales, probably will get to go not much seating. The owner was super friendly and it was a great experience. Probably my favorite little stand in Salem.I ordered the vegetable tamale plate (2 tamales, black beans, cilantro ride, sour cream, green salsa, and cheese) and two jalapeno cheese tamales on the side. I'm so excited that they have vegetarian tamales!
